record.title: We Read an Amazing Story, Chapter 4 with Editors Corrections 2
record.description: Chapter 4 begins by expressing that many organized religions and reporters in national publications like Colliers and Time have misrepresented the message of Psychiana and Psychiana's doctrine. Chapter goes on to describe the origins of Psychiana and clarifies the nature of Christ, Psychiana's teachings, and God's Power here on earth. This draft of chapter includes editorial corrections in ink. Missing pages 140 - 150.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: God-Power; Psychiana Criticism; Psychiana Origins; God on Earth
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Out of this Chaos - What?
record.description: Twelve page typescript, written by Robinson during World War II, opens with the statement that a new civilization will be the result of the chaos war has created, but soon Robinson returns to his themes of the similarities between religions and ends the typescript with a description of the beginning of Psychiana.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: World War; Doctrine Parallels; Psychiana Origin; Psychiana Prophecies;
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: The Evolution of Religion
record.description: Typescript of an article on societal evolution in the face of what Robinson calls 'the threshold of the greatest spiritual awakening' in history. Robinson divides religion into exoteric and esoteric evolution, and discusses evolution in both categories.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Article and Response
record.description: Typescript begins with an article from the Kansas City Star. Robinson follows this article with a response accusing the writer, a Methodist minister, of apologizing for his beliefs and 'poking fun at science.' Robinson asserts he would never apologize for his beliefs in Psychiana.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Being Big
record.description: Typescript of an article begins with an anecdote of a woman in Robinson's home who says she can't get into the Christmas Spirit. Robinson uses this as a platform to discuss that he would play his own hymns in his own home regardless of the nature of the holiday or his guests religious beliefs. He asserts, in his home, other beliefs are not true.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: The World Under God
record.description: Typescript of an article begins with Robinson asking a question,'What will the world be like if the knowledge of the Spirit of God is universal?' Robinson discusses the impacts of war and equates the fight for beliefs to a religious war.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: World War II; Religious War; Spirit of God
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: The New Revelation of God
record.description: Typescript of an article on what Robinson claims happens to a member of Psychiana after they eliminate the fear of sin impressed upon them by orthodox religions and begin to realize the power of the Spirit of God in their own lives. Robinson uses testimonials from Psychiana Students.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Spirit of God; Sin; Wealth and Success
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Making Us Free
record.description: Typescript of an article begins with a quote from a Christmas card wishing Robinson a successful 50 years ahead. This prompts Robinson to state that if the Spirit of God isn't revealed to everyone in 10 years he will be disappointed. Robinson also discusses a plan to organize all religious leaders to talk.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: 1938 National Convention Speech - Lecture 3
record.description: One of four lectures delivered at the 1938 National Convention. In lecture three Robinson promises to provide examples of the Power of the Spirit of God manifested in every living thing. He uses several examples, including a flower that will not grow in sawdust but will grow in dirt because of a cosmic order that governs every living thing. Another example is plants that will grow in one climate and not another, among several other examples.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Spirit of God; God-Law; Examples of God-Law
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: 1938 National Convention Speech - Lecture 4
record.description: One of four lectures delivered at the 1938 National Convention. In lecture four, Tenney begins by affirming that he will continue to support Psychiana and hopes to see a younger crowd. Robinson takes over, refuting accusations that he is an atheist. Robinson elaborates on how he differs from other orthodox religions on creed and dogma, but they all agree on the existence of God.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: The Living Among The Dead
record.description: Typescript of an article discussing the nature of the infallibility of all orthodox religions. Robinson argues if they all claim to be right, then they may all be false. Robinson uses a biblical quote--'Why seek ye the living among the dead?'--to claim these religions believe in 'dead gods,' particularly those that are crucified.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Crucified God; Bible Criticism; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Surrounded by God
record.description: Typescript of an article begins with the example of goldfish swimming in water, which allows them to live. Robinson uses this as a metaphor for the Spirit of God around us and goes on to explain how this power works on earth.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Spirit of God; God on Earth
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: The Pioneer, Chapter 1
record.description: The title for this 20 page typescript is taken from the first sentence in which Robinson states that man has a desire to pioneer into the unknowable Realm of God. It is a restatement of his belief in the God-Power, comparing contacting the 'Power' to the use of electricity in the home: flip the switch and it's there. This typescript also contains a reference to the Spirit of God as the 'Flame'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Getting Used to God
record.description: Typescript of an article discussing the difference, according to Robinson, between recognizing the Spirit of God and the ability to use it in order to draw on its power. Robinson then digresses, admittedly, to claim that Psychiana grows as it refutes other religions' doctrines that believers live apart from God.' [1 of 49 lead articles apparently written for publication in Psychiana Weekly]
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Spirit of God; Psychiana Growth; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: The Secret
record.description: Typescript of an article begins with Robinson reporting criticisms of Psychiana, and refutes the validity of other religions based on the grounds of the 'crucified god' or dead god, as he calls it. Robinson uses a quote from Henry Ward Beecher, a minister, about connecting with the Spirit of God, as Psychiana teaches.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Crucified God; Henry Ward Beecher; Spirit of God
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: The Urge of the New
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson details his prophesy of a time when no churches will exist in the world, but the world will be more 'Godly' than ever. Robinson calls this the Day of God and discusses what this day will be like.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Day of God; Church in Decline; Psychiana Prophecies
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: In the Public Interest
record.description: Typescript of an article discussing the resistance churches and orthodox religions will have to the teachings of Psychiana. Robinson regards Psychiana as his 'great responsibility' and expresses his fear that the 'world of religion' will oppose him in his teachings.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Keep Your Eyes Open
record.description: Typescript of an article responding to three other articles reporting on a reformation within the Catholic Church in America. Robinson uses these articles to discuss falsities he finds in Catholicism and accuses it of being 'the greatest system of paganism and idolatry in the world today.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Catholicism; Crucified God; Jesus Christ; Paganism; Idolatry
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Losing Ones Faith
record.description: Typescript of an article beginning with a quote from a woman who's husband has read many Psychiana lessons, but abandons them as they conflict with his Catholic faith. Robinson uses this to prompt a discussion in which he defines Psychiana as not a 'faith' but an 'experience.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Wise Virgins
record.description: Typescript of an and article beginning with Robinson's prophecy that 1940 is going to be a calamitous and bloody year. He also asserts that people must be thinking more about the Spirit of God in the face of such calamity, and goes on to explain the steps to become a Psychiana member.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: World War; Psychiana Membership; Spirit of God; Psychiana Prophecies
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Practical Power
record.description: Typescript of an article begins with a letter from a Baptist minister inquiring the difference between God in orthodox religion and God in Psychiana. Robinson responds with a discussion of the importance of how one preaches about God, rather than any difference between Gods. Robinson emphasizes how he preaches about God as a 'living spirit' on earth.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Crucified God; God on Earth; Preaching
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Cessat Superstition
record.description: Typescript of an article beginning with Robinson discussing resistance from other religions, in the form of signs, during his convention in Los Angeles. Robinson equates this 'madness' with Hitler and Stalin, and uses this as an example of the necessity of Psychiana to save the population.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: World War II; Los Angeles; Religious Resistance

record.title: Good News
record.description: Typescript of an article begins with a report that Psychiana headquarters continues to receive testimonials, but reminds followers that the battle with orthodox religion continues. Robinson discusses tools against orthodox religious systems, including public opinion.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Testimonials; Psychiana Growth; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions

record.title: The American Spiritual Awakening
record.description: Typescripts, both original and carbon, of Robinson's speeches on September 22 (9 pages), September 24 (7 pages), and October 12 (9 pages) during the American Spiritual Awakening, launched in Los Angeles and hosting meetings between Robinson and Ernest Holmes, Dean of the Institute of Religious Science and Philosophy.

record.title: Consecration
record.description: Typescript of an article indicting religious leaders. Robinson claims leaders and members of the church blaspheme against God by 'drinking whiskey, smoking cigarettes, and carousing around with women.' Robinson also equates this with the horrors in Europe.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: World War; Religious Leaders; Blasphemy; Church in Decline

record.title: The Mysterious
record.description: Typescript of an article that begins with descriptions of Psychiana from two reporters--one calling Psychiana 'mysterious' and the other calling Psychiana 'simple.' Robinson asserts that beliefs in other religions come from many sources and discusses how Psychiana operates and is very simple in its way.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: The All Sufficient Deity
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson compares the God of orthodox religion with the God of Psychiana. Robinson refutes that God messed up when creating a race he had to save. He calls this illogical. Instead, he puts his stake in a God that is a power, force, or order he calls the God-Spirit bringing man to a state of 'God-Perfection.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Spirit of God; God-Perfection; Crucified God
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Our Students
record.description: Typescript of an article beginning with Robinson's report that he hired someone to do a study of those who believe in Psychiana, which he says are in the 'high intelligence brackets.' He then asserts that fields of study like science are growing, along with the 'Science of God.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Science of God; Psychiana Students; Science and Technology

record.title: God in Action
record.description: Typescript of an article begins by reporting that many are finding the Power of the Spirit of God. Robinson reports data related to the growth of Psychiana, including member population and Headquarters expansion, and also quotes several testimonials from letters he has received.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Only Waiting
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson quotes a hymn about 'shadows' and reflects on the death of two friends, the illness of this daughter, and other current predicaments. He asserts that waiting is a virtue rather than rushing into something. He also discusses how and why the Spirit of God will take over if people only wait.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Florence Robertson; Organ; Spirit of God

record.title: Active and Passive Religion
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson divides current religions into 'active dynamic religions' and 'inactive, passive religions.' Robinson also discusses problems facing Americans, namely economic trouble, war, injustice, and his deportation.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Deportation; Automotive Industry Crisis; World War

record.title: How Foolish
record.description: Typescript of an article beginning with a discussion of the enormity of the order and power of the cosmos, using a light year as an example. Robinson goes on to criticize the absurdity of this power being packed into a 'virgin-born piece of flesh.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: What's Ahead
record.description: Typescript of an article prompted by a book entitled A Candle in the Dark by a philosopher. Robinson claims that 'no philosopher can intelligently write about present world conditions' because the world needs more than philosophy. He also discusses the ineffectiveness of the Church to make a change.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Philosophy; Church in Decline; Christianity; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions

record.title: Just Thoughts
record.description: Typescript of an article. Though dated 10-29-1939, Robinson states he is writing on Christmas Eve of the same year. Robinson reflects on the growth, challenges, and experiences he has had with Psychiana over the past decade. He also reflects briefly on current events.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Deportation; Psychiana Growth; World War; Robinson Family

record.title: Quiet Talks With God - Proving God Lives in You
record.description: Quiet Talks With God included a series of 101 newspaper columns written by Frank B. Robinson to communicate teachings of Psychiana. Column 4,'Proving God Lives in You,' discusses the miracle of birth and the fact that some Power takes over once a fetus is conceived. Robinson equates this to the power of nature and, therefore, God. This article is edited into columns on glossy paper with corrections in pencil.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: The World Chaos
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson reports on the gruesome and dire nature of World War II. He claims that Psychiana is the only organization on earth equipped to enter the world at this stage of violence when theology and religion are ill-equipped.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: World War; Pope; Church in Decline; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Abiding
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson begins with a hymnal quote and the word 'abides,' which he defines as 'to live with' and points out in biblical passages. Robinson discusses his claim that the Spirit of God lives in people, and people in biblical times were not ready to receive this information through the bad filter of religion, as opposed to knowledge, which he claims to bestow. [1 of 49 lead articles written for publication in Psychiana Weekly]
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: God on Earth; Spirit of God; Criticizing Orthodox Religions
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: A Thief in the Night
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson uses a quote from the Book of Revelation, 'God is coming like a thief in the night,' to discuss Psychiana's central teaching that God already lives on earth among us, and that peace is possible because Psychiana is revealing to people that God is already on earth from its center in Moscow, Idaho. [1st of 49 lead articles apparently written for publication in Psychiana Weekly.]
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: God on Earth; Revelation; Psychiana Growth; Moscow, Idaho; Great Day of God
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: What Right?
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson responds to the claim that he has no right to challenge the story of Christ. Robinson argues that any man has just as much right as the next to teach what he wants. He also discusses his claim that orthodox religion has done nothing to end war or to convince people of any truth behind its teaching and doctrine.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Freedom of Religion; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; World War
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: What Are We Doing?
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson responds to criticism from Rev. Billy Sunday, who asks of Psychiana 'for God's sake what are you doing out there?' Robinson uses this opportunity to restate the mission and teachings of Psychiana, including definitions for the 'The Spirit of God,' 'The Realm of the Spirit of God,' and 'God-Power.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Psychiana Criticism; Billy Sunday; Spirit of God; God-Power; Realm of the Spirit of God
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: What the Awakening is Doing
record.description: Typescript of an article beginning with a list of gods throughout history from a variety of monotheistic and polytheistic religions, revealing similarities between them. Robinson claims Psychiana is revealing the Truth to people who used to believe in these false, deceptive religions. He uses testimonials from students. Robinson also makes the claim that all religions must give up these idols.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Deities; Paganism; Idolatry; Testimonials
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: God in Actual Operation
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson lists different wires he received from someone asking for help in an emergency (i.e. a neck hemorrhaging). Robinson discusses how Psychiana and using the God-Power eventually saved people from harm and death. He addresses criticism and doubt in Psychiana, discusses his skepticism of other religions, and finally asks his students to reveal this teachings to others.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Psychiana and Healing; God-Power; Student Correspondence
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: The Significance of Psychiana
record.description: Typescript of an article. Robinson details his prophecy of a time in which the teachings of Psychiana will be fully realized as the teachings of other religions fail. Robinson also discusses the time it takes for teaching to take hold because it witnesses the present day. Robinsons calls the day when all know the Power of the Spirit of God the 'Great Day of God.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Church in Decline; Psychiana Prophecies; Great Day of God
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: The Might of God
record.description: Typescript of an article begins with Robinson ruminating on the area where Grand Coulee dam was being built. Robinson then breaks to discuss the Council of Trent and the origin of the gospels in the Bible at the hands of mere men. Then he returns to Grand Coulee dam to talk about the age-old forces of the earth and how God was present in them long before men decided what to teach.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Grand Coulee Dam; Council of Trent; Gospels; God-Power
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Home
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson discusses the presence of God in his daily life, specifically through his daughter Florence. Robinson claims that other religions tried to kill God by crucifixion but He is alive in the actions of his daughter. Robinson also lists the challenges of being the founder of Psychiana: traveling, writing, managing the Daily News-Review, etc. Also, retirement.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Florence Robinson; God on Earth; Crucified God; Robinson's Burden
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Quiet Talks With God - The Power of God
record.description: Quiet Talks With God included a series of 101 newspaper columns written by Frank B. Robinson to communicate teachings of Psychiana. Column 11, 'The Power of God,' begins by referencing previous articles about people in the U.S. having the power to stop Hitler. The article reveals this power as the Power of God and explains it in more detail. This article is a typescript not formatted for newspaper columns.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Leadings
record.description: Typescript of an article inspired by current events in the Robinson household, which lead Robinson to assert that he finds God most in his household and with his children. Robinson also affirms his experiences at home are positive, free of 'hell-fire' or 'damnation' or 'brimstone' and happening 'in a garden' and 'not in a church.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: God on Earth; Robinson Family; Spirit of God; Criticizing Orthodox Religion
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Would Jesus Mislead
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson responds to a statement claiming that Jesus Christ did preach about laws of the Universe. Robinson spends the article stating he cannot believe the story of Christ, and refutes Christ ever having preached about natural law, particularly in the fields of philosophy, science, and nature. Article also includes excerpt of a list of errors Robinson finds with Christ's teaching.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Jesus Christ; The Story of Christ; Science and Technology
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Standing Alone
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson discusses his difficult burden of bringing the message of Psychiana to the rest of the world. Robinson also discusses the current time period, which allows him to preach his message, and the persecution people used to face when they challenged Christianity.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Church Union
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson responds to statement by Rev. St. George Tucker that the Christian Church must increase its vitality and enthusiasm. Robinson uses this opportunity to agree that the church is dying, but also to argue that the religion was doomed before it began.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.

record.title: Holiness
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson responds to the question,'Do you not believe in the holiness of the Lord?' Robinson uses this question to define terms like 'holiness' as conventions and nomenclature of orthodox religion, and therefore problematic when applied to the teachings of Psychiana.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.

record.title: Spirit Control
record.description: Typescript of an article in which Robinson defines what he calls 'Spirit Control,' the ability to control the Spirit of God once you have realized it lives in and throughout you. Robinson discusses the benefits and conditions under which one lives their life once they realize they have 'Spirit Control.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.

record.title: Good News - Purpose of the Program
record.description: Radio program episode outlines the purpose of the 'Good News' radio program, to broadcast positive and peaceful things rather than negative. Episode includes organ music and songs sung by Al Marino, jokes made in the face of war, and urges listeners to buy quality-made products for better piece of mind.

record.title: Comprehending the Deity
record.description: Typescript of an article responding to a quote from Don D. Tullis on the nature of 'knowing God.' Robinson discusses the failure of Christianity to suggest that people cannot know or communicate with God, while Psychiana teaches that you can in fact know and talk to God directly.

record.title: Good News
record.description: Radio program corresponding with transcript of Radio Psychiana - Series for Dr. Frank B. Robinson No. 3. Episode begins proclaiming the growth of Pyschiana and then takes listeners to Robinson's home in Moscow, Idaho, describing its appearance. A dialogue begins between a 'guide' and Robinson about miracles, healing, the God-Law, the mail Robinson receives, and the 'Life Impulse' or 'motivating spirit' that allows people to think and live with God.

record.title: Good News - Man's Quest
record.description: Radio program episode discusses man's quest for answers, then introduces Robinson and his concept of the Cosmic God-Power. Robinson discusses the God-Power, reads a student letter asking for help, and uses the discovery of the 'cosmic ray' by Professor Milikan as evidence that there is invisible power around us. Robinson claims this Power is for our use and can bring anyone what they desire. Also includes a testimonial from a man claimed to live in Holland.

record.title: Quiet Talks With God - Always Its God
record.description: Quiet Talks With God included a series of 101 newspaper columns written by Frank B. Robinson to communicate teachings of Psychiana. Column 61,'Always It's God,' addresses the Four Freedoms speech by Roosevelt and maintains that these goals are not possible without the power of God through man. This article is a typescript not formatted for newspaper columns.

record.title: Good News
record.description: Radio program corresponding with transcript Radio Psychiana - Series for Dr. Frank B. Robinson No. 4. Episode begins with 'guide' leading listeners to Robinson's house where Robinson plays his organ. Robinson uses a metaphor of being lost at sea and the term 'misfit' to describe those who don't have access to the God-Power. Robinson then reads testimonials from students who have acquired happiness and all the desires they seek by finding the God-Power, which Robinson stresses does not take long as shown by reading recent dates on the letters.

record.title: Psychiana No. 1
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast begins with 'guide' asking general questions about Psychiana. Robinson asserts Psychiana can turn failure and into success, and uses how a radio works as an example of how knowing the God-Law allows people to 'tune in' to a great Power. Robinson also discusses what the God-Power is via the law that governs the cosmos and atoms.

record.title: Psychiana No. 2
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast. Broadcast begins with 'guide' and Robinson discussing what God is and the Christian orthodox definition of God and the stories of God. Robinson refutes orthodox stories of God as borrowed from each other. Robinson then discusses what God is to him and to Psychiana.

record.title: Psychiana No. 3
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast. Episode begins with 'guide' and Robinson discussing the nature of miracles. Robinson refutes central Christian miracles like the crucifixion, resurrection, and the others as duplicated from other myths. Robins refutes heaven as a barrier created between us and God, but Psychiana affirms that we have access to all the things we want here and now on earth by communing with God and the God-Power.

record.title: Psychiana No. 4
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast. Broadcast begins with 'guide' asking what it feels like when we commune with the God-Law, and admits feeling reservations about letting go of orthodoxy from childhood. Robinson affirms his unflinching stand against orthodox religions attacking him, and his feeling that orthodox religion did not satisfy his search for God.

record.title: Psychiana No. 5
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast. Broadcast begins with 'guide' asking one question about the afterlife and death. Robinson uses this question to call into question and refute central tenets of orthodox religious doctrine. Robinson discusses parallels of religious stories and ancient historians who fail to discuss Jesus Christ.

record.title: Psychiana No. 6
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast. Episode begins with 'guide' asking Robinson about the nature of the virgin birth. Robinson refutes the virgin birth ever happened for several reasons, specifically it defies the God-Law governing nature and the story was borrowed from heathen and pagan myths, which Robinson discusses in specific detail. Robinson also discusses who actually authored the Gopels.

record.title: Psychiana No. 7
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponding with radio transcript Psychiana No. 7. Broadcast begins with 'guide' asking Robinson about the religious notion of sin, or the fall of man, and Robinson renounces these concepts, using the opportunity to talk about the origin of Christian and Pagan myths that have no basis in fact.

record.title: Psychiana No. 8
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponds with radio transcript Psychiana No. 8. Episode begins with 'guide' asking Robinson about the Bible. Robinson points out there are many sacred books and nothing makes the Bible the sole sacred text. He argues that no proof exists that the evangelists are real and discusses more evidence against the validity of the Bible.
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana No. 9
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponds with radio transcript Psychiana No. 9. Broadcast begins with a 'guide' asking Robinson questions and pontificating on the changing times due to advances in Science. Robinson and guide discuss Robinson's convention in Los Angeles and the many attendees who have been asked to believe what orthodox religions have told them is true. Robinson criticizes beliefs of organized religions like Christianity.
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.subjects: Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Los Angeles; Science and Technology
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Quiet Talks With God - Sampling
record.description: Quiet Talks With God included a series of 101 newspaper columns written by Frank B. Robinson to communicate teachings of Psychiana. These are the first 6 of the 101 columns after formatting for final print in newspapers. Each column herein printed on newsprint typed in size 12 font.

record.title: Psychiana No. 10
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponds with radio transcript Psychiana No. 10. Broadcast begins with 'guide' asking Robinson questions about a book he is writing entitled The Number of the Beast (later called Number of the Beast '666'). Robinson also discusses a letter from someone accusing him of corrupting the faith of children.

record.title: Good News - Historical Forces
record.description: Radio program episode that uses a student letter to begin discussing examples of forces that have existed all around us but have only been discovered in recent history, including electricity and radio waves. Instincts of animals, like birds, are also used as examples that there is a Law governing nature. Robinson discusses these examples as evidence of the unseen God-Realm and God-Law.
record.subjects: God-Law; Examples of God-Law; God-Realm; Edison; Electricity; Radio
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana No. 11
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponds with radio transcript Psychiana No. 11. Broadcast begins with 'guide' noting advances in Science and asking Robinson questions. Robinson uses a storm [cueing thunder sounds] to talk about the 'superstition' of storms as a sign of God's anger. He goes on to argue against myths of sacrifice prominent and common in many organized religions.
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.subjects: Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Science and Technology; Crucifixion; Church in Decline
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana No. 12
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponds with radio transcript Psychiana No. 12. Broadcast begins with 'guide' asking Robinson questions about the fallibility of the story of Jesus Christ, to which Robinson responds he will spare no one the Truth and discusses his right to tell others of his account of God just as other religions claim they have the right to say their teachings are true.
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana No. 13
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponds with radio transcript Psychiana No. 13. Broadcast begins with 'guide' asking Robinson questions about the Trinity, to which Robinson discusses his version of the origin of religious beliefs throughout time, from cavemen, and claims the Trinity is not unique to Christianity but derived from other religions. He calls other religions 'superstitions.'
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana No. 14
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponds with radio transcript Psychiana No. 14. Broadcast begins with 'guide' asking Robinson questions about the stars, their quantity, and a 'force' that controls the cosmos. Robinson discusses electricity as neither liquid, solid, or gas, but as a force and uses it as a metaphor for the God-Law present at all times to order and control the universe.
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana No. 15
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponds with radio transcript Psychiana No. 15. Episode begins with 'guide' asking Robinson questions about the creation of the world via the God-Law and Genesis. Through dialogue, Robinson discusses contradictions that he finds in the book of Genesis that lead him to believe in the God-Law rather than Biblical accounts of Creation.
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios

record.title: Psychiana No. 16
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponds with radio transcript Psychiana No. 16. Broadcast begins with 'guide' pontificating and asking Robinson questions about the exclusivity of confessing sins and absolution to Christianity, to which Robinson explains there are different permutations of confession and absolution in the Bible as well as other religions, including pagan religions. Robinson claims he exposes the Truth about orthodox religions.
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.subjects: Christianity; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Paganism; Bible

record.title: Psychiana No. 17
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponds with radio transcript Psychiana No. 17. Broadcast begins with 'guide' asking Robinson questions about orthodox religion, sparking a discussion about rewards and punishments, heaven and hell. Robinson inquires whether heaven, as a physical place in space, actually exists and whether it makes sense to keep the prosperity of heaven out of one's reach until death if some 'force' or 'order' he calls God permeates the universe now.
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.subjects: God on Earth; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Science and Technology; Afterlife
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana No. 18
record.description: Fifteen minute radio broadcast corresponds with radio transcript Psychiana No. 18. Broadcast begins with 'guide' reporting to Robinson that people have called him an atheist, to which Robinson responds by defining the term atheism, claiming he believes his God is 'far more intelligent' than the God of the Bible. He then criticizes orthodox religions, particularly Christianity, for the notion that sinners have to be 'saved.'
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.subjects: Psychiana Criticism; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Bible

record.title: The Wanderer
record.description: Excerpts from a book written by Frank B. Robinson containing a carbon typescript of pages numbered 136-154, which correspond to pages 119-135 of the fourth chapter in the published version of the work. Excerpt discusses Robinson's journey to launch Psychiana and the origins of Psychiana, particularly initial financial investments.

record.title: Good News - Power
record.description: Radio program episode begins with assurance that there is a Power that can get people what they desire. Robinson then discusses his early life failures and childhood seeking of some force that could turn his failures into success. He asserts the God-Power can turn our failures into success and bring us material and spiritual abundance.
record.subjects: Robinson's Life; Failure; Success; Material Abundance

record.title: The Wanderer
record.description: Excerpt of chapter 5 from a book written by Frank B. Robinson. Original typescript numbered 155-166, is headed 'Chapter 5 -- In which we see 'The Wanderer' in Action.' Although chapter 5 of the published book has the same title, this typescript does not form a part of the final version. Chapter details the narrator pondering on the presence of 'The Wanderer,' a person with much knowledge about Christ and the Bible.

record.title: Christmas
record.description: Typescript on the nature of Christmas in which Frank B. Robinson addresses a dilemma about the celebration of Christmas for Psychiana followers, which prompts Robinson to discussion the history and nature of the celebration of the holiday.

record.title: We Read an Amazing Story, Chapter 5
record.description: Chapter 5 gives prominence to Frank B. Robinson's relationship with C. W. Tenney and W. W. DeBolt, both of whom were ministers defrocked for their involvement with Psychiana. Robinson uses their treatment by their churches as a means to express the 'Godless' nature of modern organized religions.

record.title: Untitled - Writing on the Search for God and the Failure of Contemporary Religion
record.description: Typescript addresses an issue with the failure of current religions to reveal God to followers and outlines Robinson's goals and stern resolve to search for Spiritual Truth and what he calls 'The Living God.'

record.title: Psychiana for Christians - Lesson 1

record.title: Religious Needs in the 20th Century
record.description: Typescript discusses the innovations of science and technology in the 20th century, and argues that a new religion is necessary that can also adapt to the changes and development of a new century. Typescript also includes a 'Psychiana Bulletin' with stories about the essential nature of religious faith.

record.title: Untitled - Writing About The Transition to a New Faith
record.description: Typescript discusses the driving power and developments in the field of science and argues that the old dogmatic faiths must stand aside to allow the foundation of new faith to be laid.

record.title: Religion
record.description: Typescript begins by discussing the nature of the word religion and the difficulty to define it as a word. Robinson then discusses central tenets of Psychiana and states that the God-Realm exists in an individual's mind.

record.title: Our Secret Weapon
record.description: Typescript begins by alluding to a weapon that, if utilized, will help Americans defeat Hitler, Mussolini, and Hirohito. Robinson reveals this power as the God-Power, the power of the creator that lives in people here on earth.

record.title: Does There Exist a Scientific Principle Which is God, and Can the Axis Murderers be Brought to a Speedy End Through This Power?
record.description: Typescript in which Frank B. Robinson refers to himself in third person as a 'man living in Moscow, Idaho.' Robinson reveals details about his life and family and claims that 'this man' can reveal a power that can be used by all people to effectively defeat the Axis enemies in Europe and the East.

record.title: The American Fifth Column
record.description: Typescript written by Frank B. Robinson about a movement that will overturn conventional understanding of God. Typescript begins with an argument that throughout the evolution of man a sense of God has existed, and a Power here on earth has existed as long as life has existed. Robinson explains that the 'American Fifth Column Movement' will change the public's traditional concept of God.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: God on Earth; God-Power; Doctrine Parallels

record.title: The American Fifth Column - The Unseen Forces of God Can Defeat the Axis
record.description: Newsletter discusses using the God-Power to defeat the Axis and defines The American Fifth Column as an organization that believes in unseen forces which can defeat the Axis powers. Includes a portrait of Frank Robinson and an article arguing that the lack of Americans attending church contributes to a lack of American moral.

record.description: Alternate draft of Chapter 4 begins by expressing that many organized religions and reporters like Colliers and Time have misrepresented the message of Psychiana and Psychiana's doctrine. record.title: Power of God-Law Amazes People - Thousands All Over the World Experience Amazing Results from New Teaching.
record.description: Typescript of an article reporting the growth of Psychiana and its body of members over the course of 10 years. Article reports Psychiana has spread to 'every part of the world' along with reporting about Robinson's wealth, and offers others this material and spiritual abundance through the 'God-Law.'

record.title: What Strange Power Is This and What Can It Actually Do for Men And Women Here and Now? [typescript on the God-Power]
record.description: Typescript explains that man, since the beginning of time, has been looking for a power here on earth, which Jesus Christ possessed. Robinson claims this power, which man has lost and exists in the present day, will not be driven from the earth, and it will be demonstrated through organizations like Psychiana.

record.title: Shoals Ahead and Crossing the Bar
record.description: Typescript uses the sea as a metaphor in which the 'vessel' that carries the author approaches rocks in the shallows. After this metaphor, Robinson transitions into Communism and the 'unGodly' threatening the future of America. He asks people to find the Spirit of God in themselves to combat this problem. Bulletin may make reference to GOP convention of 1948 in Philadelphia.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.

record.title: Dr. Frank Robinson's Formula For Revealing the Power of The Spirit of God to the Churches, and for the Elimination of the Forces of Evil which are Bathing the Earth in Blood, and Bringing Desolation and Death to Countless Thousands
record.description: Typescript begins with a quote from Dr. Jean S. Milner's book The Sky is Red, demanding a renewal of the human spirit through contact with the 'Great Spirit.' Robinson uses this quote and facts of war to give his 'formula' for connecting the Spirit of God precedence. This formula maintains that the Spirit of God manifests through spoken words and the church can also harness this power.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Spirit of God; World War; Spoken Word
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: A Conspectus of the Eleven Living Religions of the World, Arranged in the Chronological Order of Thier Origin
record.description: Table of compiled data about eleven orthodox religions in regards to each religions' name, date of birth of founder, founder, deity, present location, scripture, and number in millions of adherents.

record.title: 'Test Tube' Life Hopeless? Two Scientists Disagree
record.description: Clipping reports that man might as well give up trying to create life in a laboratory and affirms, via a quote from Dr. James Gray, that Biology provides no support as the origin of living matter in the world.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Interesting
record.description: Typescript includes statistics on the growth of Catholicism in the United States, including growth in specific cities like New York. Report also includes percentages of Catholics as criminals compared to Catholics in the entire state and asserts the number is alarming and reveals the church is the problem on the path to spiritual enlightenment.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Letter to Frank B. Robinson from a Psychiana Convert and Student
record.description: Copy made of a letter for publication. Letter details someone borrowing Psychiana Lessons from a friend, converting to the religion, and now experiencing good fortune and health. Copy also includes an editor's note, indicating this letter was pulled at random from Psychiana records for publication.
record.creator: Johnson, J. O.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: A False God
record.description: Typescript written by Frank B. Robinson describing a slanderous exchange between him and Rev. G. C. Brewer. Typescript recounts an article that originally appeared in the Gospel Advocate, reprinted in full by Robinson. Robinson claims this article was slanderous and explains that hundreds of Psychiana students have written Brewer, and uses Brewers attack to confront Christianity for attacking others throughout history.
record.subjects: Psychiana Criticism; Christianity; G. C. Brewer
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Cardinal Newman of Kindly Light was an Oxford Man
record.description: Article commemorates the centennial of the hymn of 'Kindly Light', written by John Henry Newman. Divided into sections, the article explains how Newman wrote the hymn and the historical context, including the Oxford Movement and movements toward National Apostasy in the United Kingdom.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: God Vs. the Axis
record.description: Chapters of a book written by Frank B. Robinson. Two titles typed on page one,'The Discovery of God,' and 'Rediscovering God' were discarded in favor of the above title. This typescript includes chapter 1, entitled 'This Godless World'(pp. 1-8), chapter 2,'Religion without God'(pp. 9-17) and chapter 4,'The Madness of War'(pp. 26-37). Book discusses the need for God in a Godless world ravaged by major wars. This draft includes several margin notes and editorial marks in ink.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Items From Our Mail Bag
record.description: Article from the magazine 'The Megiddo Message.' Page 1 includes testimonials and letters to the editor in regards to subscriptions and the impacts of the 'Megiddo Message' on the lives of readers from around the globe. Page 2 includes a poem or prayer entitled 'If?'
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Warning to Christians
record.description: Collage of writings almost entirely in all caps, cut up, and pasted together from various pieces of paper. Writings center around the central theme or focus that the doctrine of Christianity may not be true and that the world must come to grips with this fact or face the consequences of living this lie. Writings also include a list of indictments of Christianity. Robinson also includes a handwritten statement at the end expressing his intent to publish this collage in Spokane's largest newspaper.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Letter To My Students draft
record.description: In a letter to Psychiana students, Robinson addresses charges the United States Department of Labor brought against him, including that he is not a U.S. Citizen and must be deported. In the letter, Robinson asks his students for support him in the form a 'personal loan.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: With Our Members
record.description: Typescript includes fifteen different testimonials written during the months of October and November in 1946 from various cities around the United States. Each testimonial details how Psychiana has helped each member with various health, financial, emotional, and psychological ailments over the years.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Success or Failure, Wealth or Poverty, Which?
record.description: In this lecture, meant to be read and not presented, Robinson claims everything he did before discovering the God-Law and Realm of God ended in failure. He uses examples, such as birds mating and geese flying in a 'V,' to prove there is an ancient force we can tap into, and that he did, to find success. This copy of the lecture is printed in a booklet entitled 'Psychiana (The Teaching Which Is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World)' and numbered 'Lecture No. 2'.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Wealth and Success; Examples of God-Law; Realm of God
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.description: Radio transcript No. 1, in a series of 1 - 6, uses Jesus Christ's words--'The things that I do shall ye do also'--to inform listeners these words will come true, and they can obtain the secrets of Christ's power, even miracles, by acquiring a free copy of Robinson's lecture entitled 'Psychiana.'

record.title: Psychiana No. 2 radio transcript
record.description: Radio transcript No. 2, in a series of 1 - 6, claims that Robinson obtained the power of Christ in a flash after a 40 year search, and uses Jesus Christ's words--'The things that I do shall ye do also'--to inform listeners they can also obtain the secrets of Christ's power, even miracles, by acquiring a free copy of Robinson's lecture entitled 'Psychiana.'

Robinson about some of the central tenets of Psychiana teachings, his writings, Psychiana operations, membership, and other personal matters of belief.

record.title: Radio transcript copy no. 6
record.description: Radio transcript No. 6, in a series of 1 - 6, asks listeners if they remain unsatisfied by current dogmas and if they long to experience the power and presence of God. Transcript asserts they can discover the secret power of the universe that Christ used by acquiring a free copy of Robinson's lecture entitled 'Psychiana.'

record.title: The Bibles of the Xtian Religion: Address Delivered Philharmonic Aud. L.A. Jan 5th, 1930
record.description: Twenty-two page original typescript of an address delivered at the Philharmonic Auditorium, Los Angeles, on January 5, 1930. The introduction gives a brief history of man and the similarities between various religions. Robinson then gives a brief description of the history and various translations of the Christian Bible.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Did Jesus Christ Rise From the Dead - Easter Lecture
record.description: 37 page original typescript focuses not only on the scientific impossibility of the Resurrection, but also on the many contradictions in the Gospels. Pages 7 and 8 are missing, but since the first several lines on page 9 are crossed out, one can assume missing pages were cut from the speech. There are some corrections, both in pencil and green ink.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Radio Address By Dr. Frank Robinson On Behalf of the Candidacy of Willis Mahoney, Democratic Candidate for Governor over Radio Station KEX
record.description: Address on behalf of Klamath Falls mayor Willis Mahoney in his unsuccessful bid for the Oregon governorship, is purely political. The speech was broadcast over radio station KEX on May 17, 1934. Robinson was Mahoney's chief financial backer, and the notes in ink on the back of page six of the typescript indicate that he believed fraud and voting irregularities were the cause of Mahoney's defeat.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Lecture, Easter Sunday, April 1, 1934, Mason Temple
record.description: Typescript written and delivered at the Masonic Temple in Spokane, Washington. Similar to his Easter Lecture around 1933, Robinson explains that science has been extremely beneficial to all people and goes on to debate the scientific impossibility of the Resurrection.

record.description: Radio program about Psychiana and Robinson's beliefs. Second transcript of six includes brief introduction of Robinson and discussion in which Robinson refutes the stories of orthodox religions as mere copies of stories from other religions and uses this lack of truth to discuss what he claims is the truth--the universal law of God on earth.

record.title: Flashes of Truth No. 3
record.description: Radio program about Psychiana and Robinson's beliefs. Third transcript of six includes brief introduction of Robinson and discussion in which Robinson claims that miracles like the virgin birth and resurrection are not true. record.description: Radio program about Psychiana and Robinson's beliefs. record.title: Psychiana Peace, Happiness, and Abundance
record.description: Radio transcript on Psychiana teachings. Transcript introduces Frank B. Robinson and details the growth of Psychiana. Robinson reads a letter and testimonial from a Psychiana student. Introduction and testimonial relate to accessing the God-Power for personal success and happiness.

record.title: Psychiana No. 4 radio transcript
record.description: Radio transcript No. 4, in a series of 1 - 6, uses Jesus Christ's words--'The things that I do shall ye do also'--to inform listeners they can obtain the secrets of Christ's power. Transcript also asserts listeners can fulfill their quest for 'Truth.' They can do all this by acquiring a free copy of Robinson's lecture entitled 'Psychiana.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana Realization
record.description: Radio transcript on Psychiana teachings. Transcript introduces Frank Robinson and details the growth of Psychiana followed by the reading of a letter from a Psychiana student. Letter expresses concern at the crossroads of failure and success, to which Robinson replies that the simple realization of this crossroads shows that this person is aware of how to achieve success and travel down that path.
record.creator: The Izzard Company
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana Cosmic Rays
record.description: Radio transcript on Psychiana teachings. Transcript begins asserting man has long turned to the cosmos in search of answers and power, and that constellations and the comos operate according to the God-Law. Robinson then states he cannot take credit for this Law but it was revealed to him and people need to use it. He uses a letter from a woman in Michigan who is distraught about her marriage as an example of those who need the God-Law.
record.creator: The Izzard Company
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana Answer to Letter No. 4
record.description: Radio transcript on Psychiana teachings. Transcript begins with Robinson's response to the married woman who wrote a letter in the previous transcript,'Cosmic Rays.' Robinson asserts that 'cosmic rays' (often majestic rays scratched out in pencil and renamed cosmic) are a scientific fact no one can refute and asserts that two people should not disagree over facts. Transcript continues with more on cosmic power and another letter from a Psychiana student.
record.creator: The Izzard Company
record.subjects: Cosmic Rays; Science and Technology; God-Power; Radio Transcripts

record.title: Psychiana No. 5 radio transcript
record.description: Radio transcript No. 5, in a series of 1 - 6, refers to Robinson as 'one of the keenest psychological minds this country has ever produced' and refers to Christ as the 'Galilean Carpenter.' Transcript informs listeners they can use the same power Christ used by acquiring a free copy of Robinson's lecture entitled 'Psychiana.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: 1937 National Convention Speech - Lecture 2
record.description: Second lecture in a series of three delivered at the Masonic Temple in Portland, Oregon. Second speech begins by asking the question,'Can a Dying Church Be Saved?' Robinson asserts that things believed 400 years ago may not be true today, and goes on to discuss the loss of vitality and enthusiasm in current Christian and other religions.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Address at Trinity Auditorium in Los Angles
record.description: This appears to be a transcription of short-hand notes taken during a speech delivered on January 6, 1935. It is an original typescript, 16 pages in length. In his speech Robinson begins discussing the origin of the savior and where one can locate God.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.

record.title: 1937 National Convention Speech - Lecture 3
record.description: Third lecture in a series of three written in a dialogue, question and answer format. Robinson uses questions from audience members and others to offer fundamental teachings and guidance based on the doctrine of Psychiana.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana No. 7 radio transcript
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with 'guide' asking Robinson about the religious notion of sin, or the fall of man, and Robinson renounces these concepts, using the opportunity to talk about the origin of Christian and pagan myths that have no basis in fact.

record.title: Psychiana No. 8 radio transcript
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with 'guide' asking Robinson about the Bible. Robinson points out there are many sacred books and nothing makes the Bible the sole sacred text. He argues that no proof exists that the evangelists are real and discusses more evidence against the validity of the Bible.
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios

record.title: Psychiana No. 9 radio transcript
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with a 'guide' asking Robinson questions and pontificating on the changing times due to advances in Science. Robinson and guide discuss Robinson's convention in Los Angeles and the many attendees who have been asked to believe what orthodox religions have told them is true. Robinson criticizes beliefs of organized religions like Christianity.

record.subjects: Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Los Angeles; Science and Technology

record.title: Psychiana No. 10 radio transcript
record.description: Transcript of a 15 minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with a 'guide' asking Robinson questions about a book he is writing, entitled The Number of the Beast (later called Number of the Beast 666). Robinson also discusses a letter from someone accusing him of corrupting the faith of children.

record.title: Psychiana Untitled radio transcription
record.description: Radio transcript on Psychiana teachings. Transcript begins by using bird migration as an example that there is a law, the God-Law, that governs nature. Announcer then reads a letter about electricity and radio being discovered but always existing. Robinson replies with a lecture about inventors like Edison and the discovery of forces that always existed for all time as proof of the God-Law.

record.subjects: God-Law; Science and Technology; Radio Transcripts; Edison

record.title: Psychiana No. 11 radio transcript
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with a 'guide' pontificating advances in Science and asking Robinson questions. Robinson uses a storm [cueing thunder sounds] to talk about the 'superstition' of storms as a sign of God's anger. He goes on to argue against myths of sacrifice prominent and common in many organized religions.
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.subjects: Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Science and Technology; Crucifixion; Church in Decline

record.title: Psychiana No. 12 radio transcript
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with a 'guide' pontificating and asking Robinson questions about the fallibility of the story of Jesus Christ, to which Robinson responds he will spare no one the Truth and discusses his right to tell others of his account of God just as other religions claim they have the right to say their teachings are true.
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.subjects: Jesus Christ; Freedom of Religion; Radio Transcripts

record.title: Psychiana No. 13 radio transcript
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with a 'guide' pontificating and asking Robinson questions about the Trinity, to which Robinson discusses his version of the origin of religious beliefs throughout time, from cavemen, and claims the Trinity is not unique to Christianity but derived from other religions. He calls other reglions 'superstitions.'
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.subjects: Christianity; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Radio Transcripts
