record.title: Psychiana No. 14 radio transcript
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with a 'guide' asking Robinson questions about the stars, their quantity, and a 'force' that controls the cosmos. Robinson discusses electricity as neither liquid, solid, or gas, but as a force and uses it as a metaphor for the God-Law present at all times to order and control the universe.

record.title: I Believe; a compilation of statements on a variety of topics
record.description: This 31 page typescript includes many brief statements on a series of miscellaneous topics such as reality, success, fate, money, justice, and health. It bears no relation to any of Robinson's work, and is written in a style dissimilar to his.

record.title: Psychiana No. 15 radio transcript
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with 'guide' asking Robinson questions about the creation of the world via the God-Law and Genesis. Through dialogue, Robinson discusses contradictions that he finds in the book of Genesis that lead him to believe in the God-Law rather than Biblical accounts of Creation.

record.title: Psychiana No. 16 radio transcript
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with a 'guide' pontificating and asking Robinson questions about the exclusivity of confessing sins and absolution to Christianity, to which Robinson explains there are different permutations of confession and absolution in the Bible as well as other religions, including pagan religions. Robinson claims he exposes the Truth about orthodox religions.

record.title: Psychiana No. 17 radio transcript
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with 'guide' asking Robinson questions about orthodox religion, sparking a discussion about rewards and punishments, heaven and hell. Robinson inquires whether heaven, as a physical place in space, actually exists and whether it makes sense to keep the prosperity of heaven out of one's reach until death if some 'force' or 'order' he calls God permeates the universe now.
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.subjects: God on Earth; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Science and Technology; Radio Transcripts; Afterlife

record.title: Psychiana No. 18 radio transcript
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast. Like 'Flashes of Truth' transcript begins with 'guide' reporting to Robinson that people have called him an atheist, to which Robinson responds by defining the term atheism, claiming he believes his God is 'far more intelligent' than the God of the Bible. He then criticizes orthodox religions, particularly Christianity, for the notion that sinners have to be 'saved.'
record.creator: MacGregor & Sollie Studios
record.subjects: Psychiana Criticism; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Radio Transcripts; Bible

record.title: Miscellaneous Notes
record.description: Four unrelated, single-page documents with facts, lists, data, and quotes compiled for various reasons. Page 1 includes handwritten notes on letterhead from Davenport Hotel in Spokane, Washington, including facts about Psychiana, someone's plight to offer the truth about religion, and random phrases like 'agreeable moon cheese.' Page 2 includes data about the population and amount of orthodox churches in various states, concluding that only 10% of people attend church on Sundays and only 40% are on church registers. Page 3 includes fragments of what appears to be lecture notes on the real origin of orthodox beliefs and the current turmoil and godlessness of World War II. Page 4 includes the address of Saint Germain Press in Chicago, a list of book/journal titles, and two long quotes on opportunity and the nature of resentment in the American people.
record.subjects: Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Lecture Notes; World War II
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Jack Holden Broadcast
record.description: Radio transcript of conversation between Jack Holden, Frank Robinson, and Henry Burr. Radio transcript records a discussion between Robinson, Holden, and Burr as they paraphrase from letters they claim have been written and either sent or wired to Robinson over the weekend. Various paraphrases include praise and testimonials from Psychiana students, correspondence from celebrities like Tommy Burns, and letters in regards to Robinson's material success.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Testimonials; Tommy Burns; Radio Transcripts; Robinson's Wealth

record.title: Psychiana Call to Arms
record.description: Radio transcript on Psychiana teachings. Transcript begins asserting if one understands and uses the God-Power he or she can end poverty by obtaining material possessions and becoming peaceful. Robinson then discusses the abundance of power in the spiritual realm, the God Realm. The announcer asserts we can use this power to create a world where poverty and suffering are 'impossibles.'

record.description: First lecture in a series of three delivered at the Masonic Temple in Portland, Oregon. First speech begins with broad questions (i.e. Is there a God?) and discusses the general teachings and practices of Psychiana. Includes letters from Robinson's students.

record.title: 1938 National Convention Speech - Lecture 1
record.description: One of four lectures delivered at the 1938 National Convention. In lecture one, Tenney asks for donations and Robinson follows with several testimonials compiled from various students of Psychiana and data about the growth of Psychiana from its origins in Moscow, Idaho to expansion in various American cities and other countries around the world.

record.title: Radio Psychiana - Series for Dr. Frank B. Robinson No. 1
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast on various themes. Transcript begins with a 'guide' pontificating and asking Robinson questions. Robinson discusses the subject of security and the future. He uses letters from students to discuss how people seek security in their future and how the God-Law, if harnessed, can provide his students with whatever they need materially.

record.title: The Flame
record.description: 'The Flame' is a single chapter, 26 pages in length, of perhaps a longer book. It exists both in the original and carbon typescript. The 'Flame' referred to is another name for what Robinson has called the 'Spirit of God' (see the manuscript 'The Pioneer' p. 14). There is, beginning on page eleven, a description of Long Crendon, Buckinghamshire, both when Robinson lived there as a child and when he visited in 1934.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.

record.title: Radio Psychiana - Series for Dr. Frank B. Robinson No. 2
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast on various themes. Transcript begins with a 'guide' pontificating and asking Robinson whether man can actually talk to God. Robinson claims that men can actually talk to God due to mental powers that men have discovered and are still discovering. Robinson asserts that people are now able to 'get in touch' with the God-Law and by doing so can talk with God.

record.title: Radio Psychiana - Series for Dr. Frank B. Robinson No. 3
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast on various themes. Transcript begins with a 'guide' pontificating and asking Robinson about the nature of miracles. Robinson affirms that miracles don't exist and that what we call miracles are actually the God-Law operating here and now in the world. Things like medical advances come from the Realm of the Spirit of God and therefore are not miracles.
record.creator: The Izzard Company
record.subjects: Miracles; Spirit of God; Radio Transcripts
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Radio Psychiana - Series for Dr. Frank B. Robinson No. 4
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast on various themes. Transcript begins with a 'guide' pontificating and Robinson interrupts by using the term 'misfit' to describe those who have not found the God-Power. He uses the metaphor of a ship lost at sea, not knowing where the ports are, to discuss life without direction like the God-Power and happiness. Robinson uses student testimonials. This typescript is heavily edited in pencil.
record.creator: The Izzard Company
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Radio Psychiana - Series for Dr. Frank B. Robinson No. 5
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast on various themes. Transcript begins with a 'guide' pontificating and asking Robinson about how we find success. Robinson uses the testimonial from a student and asserts that the best way to find success is through the God-Law.
record.creator: The Izzard Company
record.subjects: Testimonials; Wealth and Success; Radio Transcripts
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Radio Psychiana - Series for Dr. Frank B. Robinson No. 6
record.description: Transcript of a fifteen minute radio broadcast on various themes. Transcript begins with a 'guide' pontificating and asking Robinson how people can make dreams of happiness a reality. Robinson asserts that people must be really quiet and concentrate on the force that moves deep down inside them as it goes through every living thing. Robinson elaborates on this force.
record.creator: The Izzard Company
record.subjects: Wealth and Success; God-Law; Radio Transcripts; Quiet Meditation
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: The New World Religion
record.description: Typescript of an article expressing Robinson's claim that enrollment in church services are declining all over the world, but that there is hope for a new faith and belief for those who are losing faith in current, established religions.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Church in Decline; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Gleams Over the Horizon
record.description: Typescript of an article discussing Robinson's claim that a new religion will come out of the all the destruction and loss in Europe and Asia in World War II. Robinson also discusses the resistance to this new religion by long established religions and criticizes these religions, namely Christianity.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Christianity; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions; Psychiana Prophecies
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: How to Use the Power
record.description: Typescript of an article on Robinson's claim that the Power of the Spirit of God lives in every individual and that the doctrine of other faiths, namely Christianity, have confused this reality of the God-Power. Robinson also discusses his discovery of this Power.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: 1938 National Convention Speech - Lecture 2
record.description: One of four lectures delivered at the 1938 National Convention. In lecture two Tenney begins by explaining Psychiana is revising their lesson distribution method and asks for more donations, using student testimonials. Robinson continues his lecture on the growth of Psychiana and discusses the expansion of Psychiana in the face of old religions that ask people to give things up and blindly follow doctrines they say is true. He claims that people are looking for new Power and that is why Psychiana expands.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Psychiana Growth; God-Power; Criticizing Orthodox Reilgions
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: The Quick and the Dead
record.description: Typescript of an article on Robinson's claim that there two types of people in the world: those who know the God-Power and live with it (who he calls 'the quick') and those who are alive because of the God-Power but refuse to acknowledge it (who he calls 'the dead'). Robinson also discusses what he claims is the failure of Christianity.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Missing Links in the Evolutionist's Argument
record.description: Brochure discusses the creation of man in God's image versus the theory of evolution and origin of the human race from a 'lower order.'
record.creator: Brooks, Keith L.
record.subjects: Evolution; In God's Image; Origin of Man; Jesus Christ
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Here's Your Answer!
record.description: Pocket-sized booklet includes several common questions about religion along with various answers in the form of or including quotes from the Christian Bible.
record.creator: Brooks, Keith L.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Student Correspondence 1931
record.description: Single correspondence filed from 1935 includes letters between student and return letter from Robinson. Moore discusses losing his sight in the war and getting it back due to Psychiana. He says he 'sold' eight friends on Psychiana and mentions including their contact information for Robinson to contact them.
record.creator: Moore, Merle H.; Frank B. Robinson
record.subjects: Student Correspondence; Healing; World War; Spreading Psychiana; Testimonials
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Student Correspondence 1937, K-Z
record.description: Letters exchanged between DeBolt or Robinson and students with last names beginning alphabetically K-Zdiscussing the exchange of Psychiana lessons, subscriptions to Psychiana publications, payment for these materials, donations, personal successes or hardships, and/or praise or dissatisfaction with Psychiana materials and teachings. Return letters address these concerns, often as form letters.

record.title: Student Correspondence 1948, Cl-Cu
record.description: Letters exchanged between DeBolt or Robinson and students with last names beginning alphabetically Cl-Cudiscussing the exchange of Psychiana lessons, subscriptions to Psychiana publications, payment for these materials, donations, personal successes or hardships, and/or praise or dissatisfaction with Psychiana materials and teachings. record.title: Notes from Robinson to Staff
record.description: Letters and notes that include instructions for how to manage Psychiana employees, referred to as 'girls,' while Robinson is away. Includes insults, disciplinary action, sending staff home, and specific instruction about Psychiana mail.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Psychiana Staff; Psychiana Headquarters; Mailings; Pearl Bey Robinson
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Letter from Robinson to Better Business Bureau
record.description: Robinson accuses Better Business Bureau of being unAmerican, Subversive, and anti-religious. Robinson also asks Mr. Greene to indicte Psychiana in Federal Court rather than in newspapers and magazines.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Psychiana Criticism; Better Business Bureau; Indictment
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Letter from Frank B. Robinson to United States Congressman
record.description: Letter describes farmers in northern Idaho struggling due to inflation as government employees under the New Deal make higher wages.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Robinson and Politics; Farmers; New Deal; Inflation
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Letter from Postmaster Regarding Mail Classification of 'Psychiana Monthly'
record.description: Letter lists several requirements of second class mail, details material included in Psychiana Monthly, and catagorizes its subscribers and content in order to determine its mail classification.

record.subjects: Mailings; Second Class Mail; Postmaster General

record.title: Personal Letter from Arthur Robinson [01]
record.description: Letter mentions missing Robinson in London in August, 1934, and goes on to comment on Robinson not getting a chance in direct touch with their father.

record.title: Personal Letter from Arthur Robinson [02]
record.description: Letter responds to a letter from Robinson and details the scandal of an affair between their father and another woman. Arthur also asks Robinson personal details about himself and family.

record.title: Exchange of Letters Robinson and A. C. Plagge
record.description: Documents include a Western Union telegram giving Plagge sole authority to publish Psychiana courses, and a letter from Plagge to Robinson notifying him that a translator is filing a lawsuit and attempting to claim Psychiana lessons in Holland as his own.

record.title: A Merry Xmas
record.description: Form letter signed by Robinson, printed in red and green wishing readers a Merry Christmas and asking for fincial assistance through the coming year. Also includes seasonal greeting card with a photo of a house in winter and in summer.

record.title: Psychiana - Dancing Flashes of Power
record.description: Form Letter speaks of the God-Power often in metaphorical terms--i.e. as the surging of waves--that can move through a person. Robinson appeals to those who have felt weak in their lives and would like to have the happiness of those they see enjoying life around them. He offers this through Psychiana and primarily the God-Power, which he states is located inside them.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Here is One of Tens of Thousands of Letters We Have Received, Telling What the God-Realm Does [02]
record.description: Flyer features reprint of a letter from a Psychiana student and her husband who have spread the word of Psychiana to others. The student also claims that her husband has left hard, difficult labor and also has better health and protection due to Psychiana. In bold red ink after the letter the flyer reads, 'YOU MAY HAVE A SIMILAR EXPERIENCE.'
record.creator: Psychiana, Inc.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.description: Flyer printed with large bold '11,738' over the header, claiming this is the number of 'American Cities, Towns, Villages, and Hamlets' with Psychiana members. Also lists the names of states with corresponding numbers of cities in those states where Psychiana mails material (i.e. Oregon - 246).

record.title: To All Enquirers [07]
record.description: Letter sent to new Psychiana students assuring them that their membership information was received and that they will receive lesson no. 1 via mail shortly. Letter also asserts they have opened the door to a new Power in their life, using various metaphors of space and others to relay the vastness of this Power.
record.creator: Tenney, C.W.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Read This Letter If You Have Any Doubts as to What the God-Law Can Do
record.description: Flyer features the reprint of a letter from a Psychiana student who received the lessons and went from a life of fear, failure, hardship, and misfortune to a life without fear. In bold red ink after this letter, flyer asks readers to let the God-Law work for them.

record.title: Psychiana Weekly - Jan. 6, 1940
record.description: Issue of Psychiana Weekly, scanned from the only bound copy in existence of all 52 issues printed in 1940. record.title: Read This [01]
record.description: Flyer features reprint of a letter from a Psychiana student thanking Robinson for opening her eyes to the God-Law and God-Realm and has donated $20 in the past and will give freely in the future because the God-Law gives freely. In bold red ink after this letter, readers are told if they don't think the God-Law can do this for them, 'THEY ARE MISTAKEN.'

record.title: A Word of Explanation
record.description: Letter explains donation system on member registration cards, clarifying that those who can't donate amounts indicated on card can write in amounts as low as one dollar. Robinson states lessons have moved to a 'free-will donation basis' rather than a flat rate charge because he wants all students to have lessons, but overhead and advertising expenses 'MUST be paid.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Why Be Afraid
record.description: Clipping details the experience of a veteran who claims to have fought in two wars and begins discusssing the pervasive nature of terror and fear in the daily life of citizens in the face of major world wars and how God can alleviate that fear.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Scientists Discover 'Cement' of the Universe; Words as an Active Force In Daily Life; Musings of a Traveling Man
record.description: Clippings of several articles including reports of experiments to separate atoms in a machine at the Carnegie institute in Washington, the ability to will something through words and repetition, and a report that Frank B. Robinson sent out literature asking people to use the God-Power to stop Hitler.

record.title: Text of the Baccalaureate Sermon
record.description: Clipping recounts, verbatim, a large portion of Bishop Leete's baccalaureate sermon in Syracuse and expands on Leete's notion of the existence of God, either from on high or among men, and the necessity of God to exist for the happiness of man. Uses examples from History.
record.subjects: Lectures; Origin of God; Bishop Leete
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Science Tells A Troubled World To Go Back to Religion
record.description: Clipping begins with the assertion, by psychologist Carl Jung, that anxiety and fear are a cause of men and women being afraid to die and there is a direct connection between 'Empty Churches and Crowded Arsenals.'
record.subjects: World War; Origin of God; Church in Decline; Carl Jung; Psychology
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Something New Desperately Needed
record.description: Clipping catalogues the experience of a minister grown disillusioned with the church due to the clerical nature of Christendom and draws a correlation between this disillusionment and increases in brutality, war, and the failure of religious revivals.
record.creator: Bland, Salem G. D.D.
record.subjects: World War; Church in Decline; Church Administration

record.title: Compton Finds New Cosmic Ray Facts; Man, In Time, May Be Rebuilt
record.description: Clippings report the findings of scientist Dr. Arthur Holly Compton, who used a machine to take a closer look at cosmic rays striking the earth, and Professor Hans Spemann and Professor Ross G. Harrison who discovered the existence of an 'inductor' or 'organizer' in the embryonic tissue of animals.

record.title: Fasting Dean Warns Church; Episcopal Dean in Strange Fast; Peaches in Memphis on 14th Day of Fast

record.title: The Other Mary
record.description: Correspondence between Psychiana and a student who sent a story he wrote about Jesus Christ. Text includes a handwritten letter to Frank B. Robinson proclaiming Markham's acceptance of Psychiana as his new religion and reports events of his life. record.title: Frank B. Robinson responds to other religious movements
record.description: Clipping reports Frank B. Robinson's response to other religious movements; the immunity from intrusion, molestation, and taxes religions have in a free country; and collection agencies contacting Psychiana members delinquent on payments.

record.title: Man Can Talk to God
record.description: Article written from Everyday Psychology and Inspiration by Frank B. Robinson describes the hardships and trials of the first five years after founding Psychiana, including the overwhelming growth and response from the public, the resistance Psychiana has faced by other religions, and the new vision of God the world needs.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.subjects: Psychiana Growth; Psychiana Criticism; Channeling God; Hardship
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Death of Psychiana
record.description: Article about Frank B. Robinson's death and the fate of Psychiana, in the 'Religion' section of Newsweek. Article briefly summarizes the history and growth of Psychiana contrasted with the death of Frank B. Robinson in 1948 and the official announcement from his son and wife that Psychiana will no longer distribute materials via mail due to increase in cost.
record.subjects: Robinson's Death; Alfred B. Robinson; Psychiana Growth
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: I Talked with God
record.description: Article and photographs from Pic details the origins of Psychiana and accusations that Psychiana is actually a business or corporation rather than a religion. Includes multiple photographs of Frank B. Robinson, his family, projects, colleagues and Psychiana headquarters.
record.subjects: Psychiana Origin; Robinson Family; Psychiana Headquarters; Psychiana Criticism

record.title: The Man Who Talked With God
record.description: Article from Thrill summarizing the origins of Psychiana, Robinson's beliefs, and focusing on the volume of material Psychiana mails and the large postage bill. Includes multiple photographs of Frank B. Robinson, his family, colleagues, Psychiana headquarters, and a Psychiana lecture.
record.subjects: Psychiana Origin; Robinson Family; Mail Order Religion

record.title: Letterheads Used by Frank B. Robinson

record.title: Psychiana, Inc. article
record.description: Article from Tide Magazine discusses the finances of Psychiana including the amount of money spent on mailing materials, the religion's status as a nonprofit, Frank B. Robinson's salary, and where and how much Robinson spends on advertising.
record.subjects: Finances; Mail Order Religion; Nonprofit; Advertising

record.title: Money-Back Religion
record.description: Article from Time summarizes the origin and life of Psychiana and Frank B. Robinson, focusing initially on the first advertisements Robinson bought and a $40,000 investment from cotton broker Geoffrey Peel Birley, through the controversy surrounding Robinson's citizenship, deportation, and awaiting naturalization.

record.title: The Miracle Man from Moscow
record.description: Article from Western Advertising explains that people are looking for God in this changing time and moves to call Psychiana a success due to 'phenomenal advertising results.' The article elaborates on Robinson's doctrine of receiving blessings here on earth rather than waiting for the afterlife, how he advertises, and includes a print ad used by Robinson.
record.subjects: Advertising; Here vs. Hereafter; Psychiana Growth

record.title: The Humanist Pulpit - Did Jesus Rise from the Dead?
record.description: Pamphlet contains an address delivered before First Unitarian Society for distribution. Pamphlet discusses whether Jesus Christ rose from the dead, breaking this argument down into the evidence surrounding the ability for his physical body to have left his grave versus the idea of the resurrection based on faith rather than any concrete evidence. Includes annotations in pencil.
record.creator: Dietrich, John H.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: The Humanist Pulpit - Did Jesus Really Live
record.description: Pamphlet contains an address delivered before First Unitarian Society for distribution. Pamphlet discusses the controversy surrounding the claim that Jesus of Nazareth, the man who walked the earth as the manifestation of God, never actually existed in history and recounts historical arguments for and against this claim.
record.creator: Dietrich, John H.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: The Humanist Pulpit - What's Happening to Religion
record.description: Pamphlet contains an address delivered before First Unitarian Society for distribution. Pamphlet discusses history of religion, then many different denominations that split from Catholicism, and how religion has changed through the course of history due to innovations like agriculture and events like World War II. Includes handwritten annotations.
record.creator: Dietrich, John H.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Letter from initials 'JLK' to Frank B. Robinson
record.description: Letter details 'JLK's' actions on August 31, 1946 as well as musings about Russia and Turkey, war, greed, and other topics. Also includes of list of words defined objectively, 'prophecies', and several drawings and doodles done by hand.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Lesson No. 1 with Special Instructions to Our Students
record.description: First lesson mailed to students of Psychiana includes an introduction to teachings and asks readers not to question what Robinson says, establishing roles of 'teacher' and 'student.' Robinson also asks readers to dispel any notion of a 'subconscious mind' in lieu of some other force. Robinson instructs readers about quiet meditation, mantras, and other practices.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Lesson No. 2 - The Story of Creation
record.description: Lesson discusses relationship between science and the Bible as they pertain to the story of creation. Robinson claims science and the Bible are not in opposition, but 'corroborate' or 'dovetail' each other. He discusses interpretation, and eventually creates a hierarchy of science over religion when the two clash (i.e. is it possible that the world was truly created in 6 days?).
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 3 - Who and What God Actually Is
record.description: Lesson discusses what God is and multiple ways men defined God over thousands of years. Robinson also discusses Jesus as the most qualified to reveal what god is and draws attention to poor translations of Jesus' words by average men: God is not 'a spirit' but that God 'is spirit.' He defines God as 'a presence' and 'a dynamic power in the universe,' giving examples of how the force that God is works on earth.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 4 - The Creation and Fall of Man
record.description: Lesson discusses the story of Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden, and the moment of the Fall. Robinson uses to Fall not as humanity's decent into sin, but rather the point at which man's eyes opened to the physical world and closed to the spiritual world. This creates a 'senses veil' that does not allow people to see God as he works on earth among us. Robinson then encourages students to use their lesson time to sit quietly, concentrate, and talk directly to God.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 6 - Jesus--Who He Was and What He Came To Do
record.description: Lesson begins discussion of Robinson's relationship with Jesus Christ. He discusses the separation of the physical and spiritual worlds, stating that it's true the two are separate but calls the Christian belief that people can only access the spiritual realm after death, in heaven, a shame. Robinson asserts the shame of religion is that it clouds truths of God and Jesus as they were originally taught.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 7 - Jesus--Who He was and What He Came To Do--(Cont.)
record.description: Lesson includes Robinson's interpretations of the Bible and life of Jesus Christ from birth to resurrection. Robinson debates whether Jesus Christ actually was a God and whether Jesus was different, biologically at least, from any other human being on earth. Robinson concludes Jesus' power is evidenced to come from the 'Life Spirit,' which can be duplicated on earth now.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 8 - Jesus--Who He Was and What He Came To Do--(Cont.)
record.description: Lesson continues discussion of Jesus Christ, maintaining that Jesus was just as much man as he was God. Robinson discusses 'New Psychology' and its discovery of the Living God, though it doesn't call It God. He tells an anecdote about a hen with a broken leg that healed after he thanked God in advance for healing it, and asserts that miracles don't exist because miracles are the Power of the Living God and only happen if the Living God wills them.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 9 - Healing
record.description: Lesson discusses nature and science of healing. Robinson discusses drug trials and why so many people rely on drugs like aspirin to cure ailments. Robinson also discusses the money the drug industry has tied up in medicine and uses healing as a platform to assert that there is no need for drugs if people only trusted the Power of the Spirit of God.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Preaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Lesson No. 10 - How to Take What You Need
record.description: Final lessons in first course asserts that students now have the same methods that Christ used while he lived on earth. Robinson also discusses the Power or getting what you want, and uses Biblical quotes and promises that people will get what they want if they pray, even in a time of 'unbelief' when 'affirmations of faith are necessary.' Robinson asks students to use the affirmation 'I believe in the Living God' until they get an 'answer' to what they want.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course - Introductory Lecture
record.description: First Advanced Lesson asks students to read in a quiet place. Robinson discusses an 'immutable, inviolable, and never-changing Law' that governs the universe. He offers examples of this law: geese flying in a 'V' by instinct, seeds sprouting, etc. He then discusses the discoveries of 'New Psychology,' and the Power that has been called the subconscious mind.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 1
record.description: Advanced lesson focuses primarily on the nature of success and failure. Robinson appeals to those who 'struggle with unhappiness, ill health, lack of money, or business failure.' He discusses the cosmos and how the same Immutable Law, or God-Law, that governs the stars also governs 'HEALTH, HAPPINESS, and MATERIAL ABUNDANCE' and many people don't know how to use this Power.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 2
record.description: Advanced lesson discusses life as a card game, where cards are the lives we inherit including education, circumstances, and fortune. Robinson discusses how to change a 'losing hand' through the God-Law. Robinson discusses the clash between religion and his teachings, and asserts that God is not a being to be feared but a force we can commune with for mastery over our lives.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 3
record.description: Advanced lesson discusses the creation of man and earth. Robinson expresses his disbelief in traditional doctrine that God is a being located in heaven, or a far place, while asserting that their is a force acting and creating on earth. He compares creation theories of science and evolution to Biblical accounts. He uses the terms 'Law' and 'Power' interchangeably.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 4
record.description: Advanced lesson promises happiness and success to students who understand the God-Law. Robinson discusses rifts between doctrines of orthodox religion and Psychiana. He claims Jesus is not divine and maintains that Psychiana offers a commune with God, a Spiritual Force acting on Earth. Repeats passages from Lesson No. 3 in first, non-advanced 10 lessons.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 5
record.description: Advanced lesson begins reviewing advanced lessons 1 - 4, then discusses the magnitude of the God-Law though astronomy. Robinson equates the God-Law with the laws of physics that govern newly discovered stars, cosmic distances, and planetary systems unknown when beliefs in orthodox religions were originally founded.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 6
record.description: Advanced lesson focuses on the development of knowledge and philosophy since the dark ages. Robinson refers to many different thinkers, including St. Augustine, Spinoza, and Immanuel Kant, and developments in fields of science and astronomy. Robinson also discusses the nature of religious theories or 'guess work' established during past periods of primitive thought.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 7
record.description: Advanced lesson focuses on the terminology of the God-Law as a Law, which Robinson maintains is not subject to varying interpretation like gods of other religions because it is a law, like a law in nature. Robinson discusses a force or law that governs how cellular biology and astronomy work as examples of the God-Law.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 8
record.description: Advanced lesson begins discussing discovery of the 'cosmic ray' as proof that some law or force exists in the universe. Robinson draws correlations between deities in different religions as evidence that religion borrows and shares information. He calls theology and religion 'guess work' at finding the true existence of the force that is God.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 9
record.description: Advanced lesson establishes idea that man never 'fell,' but instead climbs from cave-man understanding to our current understanding of the world. Robinson asserts that the only limitation in accessing the God-Law and God-Power and using it to your advantage is yourself. Robinson also discusses original sin and the Christian creation story as myth.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 10
record.description: Advanced lessons asserts the God-Power is always on and working all the time, and stresses the importance of grasping what that means. He asserts that the God-Power works for anyone of any race throughout the world. He gives various examples to show constancy and potential of the God-Power even if it is not 'complied with.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 11
record.description: Advanced lesson is an extended anecdote of Robinson's life and how he came to know the God-Law. Robinson begins with his childhood and father, a Baptist minister. He tells of his hardships before Psychiana and how he came to success through Psychiana and the little affirmations that he says every day as he spreads his teachings to others.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 12
record.description: Advanced lesson centers around articles by the associated press in which scientists have offered discovers and theories about the expanding of the universe, life in distant galaxies, the Big Bang, etc. Robinson also claims that no scientists believe in the Biblical story of Creation and scientists that were once atheists are prescribing to beliefs in larger forces.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
