record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 13
record.description: Advanced lesson focuses on Jesus Christ, which Robinson often refers to by his profession, the Galilean Carpenter. Robinson draws a correlation between astronomy and history and between 'saviors' in other religions to refute the 'supernatural' surrounding Christ's birth. Robinson does not doubt he was born and lived, and discusses Christ's likeable personality and how he was misunderstood.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 14
record.description: Advanced lesson begins by stating that students should be ready to use the God-Power in their lives, then turns to a discussion of the secret of Christ's power. Robinson discusses that miracles don't exist, and that miracles are really the Creative Spirit of Life, the God-Law, acting in 'perfect naturalness.' He discusses how Christ harnessed the God-Power and students can as well.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 15
record.description: Advanced lesson recaps the previous lesson, reminding students they can access the God-Power, then discusses what students can do with this God-Power once they access it. Robinson asserts it is impossible to make a failure of your life if you accept the God-Power, and you can acquire all that you need. For example, if the God-Power can make a lily beautiful, why can't it provide you with the best apparel?
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 16
record.description: Advanced lesson begins citing Associated Press articles about the discovery of the neutron. Robinsons uses this, and facts about the size of the neutron, to further reiterate that the unseen force he calls the God-Law is working in the present day, and we are discovering more and more about it every day. He also prophesizes about the fate of the world in the advent of these discoveries.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 17
record.description: Advanced lesson discusses the central topic of Life. Robinson describes a scene in a city without life, where all things would stop if Life didn't exist, and deduces that you (speaking to the reader) are life now. He stresses the importance of the temporal and the God-Law happening now, on earth. Robinson criticizes orthodox religions for doctrines that prevent people from knowing anything about Life until they die.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 18
record.description: Advanced lesson discusses the role of happiness from material possessions and nonmaterial things, especially a direct relationship with God. Robinson tells an anecdote about an exhibit of torture devices he claims were used by the Christian church to punish heretics, then further discusses the idea of opening the 'mansion' to the Realm of God with the 'key of peace.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which Is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 2
record.description: Lesson discusses the topic of 'worship.' Robinson claims the God of Psychiana does not need worship or tribute, but rather to be contacted and used. He reiterates the importance of meditation and affirmations as practices to contact this God. He also discusses Jesus Christ as a man who contacted this God and used It.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 19
record.description: Advanced lesson works to define the Spiritual Realm and our connection to it. Robinson distinguishes the God-Power from the will, and attributes the growth of Psychiana to knowing the God-Power. Robinson recaps the connection to the Spiritual Realm via electrical signals in our brains, like cosmic rays in space, that are forces he calls God acting through us.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 3
record.description: Lesson begins discussing the magnitude of the Power of God. Robinson then discusses eternal life, which he claims can be achieved through the God-Power. He claims this is our main purpose. He also quotes several scientists and other texts about the cosmos and other discoveries of science as illustrations of forces and powers in nature.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 4
record.description: Lesson discusses, at length, the discovery of the 'cosmic ray' and attempts to further impress upon students the existence of a Law or Force working through the Universe. Robinson coins a new term, 'Realm of the Cosmic Ray.' Robinson also discusses how people have resisted technological advances in history like they resist Psychiana, and how the Power manifests itself positively in Robinson's own life.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 5
record.description: Lesson discusses people getting close to the Realm of God and seeing what Robinson calls 'Spiritual Faces.' He tells the story of seeing manifestations of people and corpses when he needed a name for his religion for his first advertising deadline. This is where the name Psychiana came from - a vision. Robinson also discusses what the manifestation the God-Power will be like for students.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 6
record.description: Lesson discusses the demand by young people for a new, satisfying religion. Robinson also tells anecdotes of witnessing death in the natural world among animals and war in human history. He claims these circumstances are the God-Law allowed to run wild. Finally he discusses excerpts from Revelation, calling John 'the Dreamer,' and how a great leveling is happening in the present economic and physical world.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 7
record.description: Lesson discusses the nature of doubt in all people. First, Robinson gives examples of evolution and progress that he claims are examples the God-Law is working and creating progress. Among the examples, he includes political and social reforms, like communism. He then discusses the nature of doubt and attempts to prove, through God Itself, that what Robinson preaches is Truth.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 8
record.description: Lesson focuses on a discussion of fear, what it is and where it comes from. Robinson traces fear back to an instinct to survive in animals. He introduces a notion he calls the 'separated self' and claims that he is both a mystic and atheist, if that is what people want to call him, for his beliefs about natural feelings of fear and survival as opposed to natural want of happiness and comfort.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 9
record.description: Lesson focuses on discussions of 'Faith' and 'Immortality,' defining either term and discussing its contemporary definition through orthodox doctrine, the miracle of the Resurrection, and history. Robinson equates the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ with historic assassinations of U.S. presidents. Robinson also discusses the Gospels as sources of information about Immortality and historical accuracy.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 10
record.description: Lesson continues discussion of immortality and history. Robinson starts discussing free will and the futility of Sin in a world where actions are predetermined. He also discusses the culmination of history in terms of the ideas of humans and asks where the idea comes from. Finally, he discusses outside influences on individuals that contribute to fear and other negative developments and perceptions in the mind.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 1
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson designed for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson discusses knowledge and the purpose and source of where education and knowledge come from. Robinson discusses role of teachers, particularly priests, and criticizes Christian methods of torturing heretics. Robinson also summarizes what student-teachers can expect in lessons to come, stating he hasn't revealed all his knowledge yet.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 2
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson designed for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson promises material and financial remuneration. Robinson also criticizes teaching methods of the 'church' and preachers like Billy Sunday, and makes several accusations against the Salvation Army. He offers his interpretations on the genealogy of Jesus, quoting from the Gospels.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 3
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson focuses primarily on Robinson's views of doctrines in other religions. Robinson claims Psychiana's growth is due to his fierce honesty, and he locates himself and Psychiana in opposition of all other organized, orthodox religions. He denies the story of Christ and offers his views, in list format, on the Bible and doctrine derived therefrom.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Advanced Course Number One - Lesson No. 20
record.description: Final lesson of advanced course number one seeks to recap nomenclature (somewhat interchangeably) and relationship between the Spirit of God, God Realm or Spiritual Realm, God-Law, Life Principle or Life Spirit, and God-Power. Robinson speaks metaphorically of plumbing and water pumped into every home from a reservoir, and defines a new term he calls 'The Great Without,' or power coming from outside the body, from nature and the cosmos.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 4
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson focuses further on dispelling stories and foundational teachings of orthodox religions. Robinson uses the genealogy of Christ, the words of Clarence Darrow, and the case of Michael Servetus's heresy and execution as examples of the lack of validity of orthodox religion, particularly Christianity.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 5
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson compares stories of saviors and deities from multiple religions, from pagan religions to Christianity, in order to draw correlations and make claims that stories, myths, and doctrine are often drawn from similar sources and origin stories despite each religion's claim that their doctrine is 'right' or 'true.'
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 6
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson further catalogues what Robinson calls the 'sixteen crucified Saviors of the world.' Robinson summarizes crucifixion stories from as far back as 725 b.c. from many different religions and countries throughout the world. Robinson discusses origins of the crucifixion myth and inconsistencies between historical accounts and Biblical evangelist accounts.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 7
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson further discusses correlations between religious and pagan stories, focusing primarily on Jesus Christ's descension into hell as well as descension stories of other deities in both monotheistic and polytheistic religions as far back as Greece and as diverse as the Egyptians and Aztecs.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 8
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson further discusses correlations between religious and pagan stories, focusing primarily on Jesus Christ's ascension into heaven as well as ascension stories of other deities in both monotheistic and polytheistic religions. Robinson also discusses the parallels in the stories of atonement for sins via vegetable, animal, and human sacrifice.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which Is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Course Number Two - Lesson No. 1
record.description: Lesson reprints two letters and a wire Robinson claims to have received from people needing or asking for help and then having their problems--whether financial, health related or other--answered by 'contacting' the God-Realm and asking for what they desired. Robinson focuses on contacting the God-Realm to get what one desires as in his letters and examples, and reminds students to do his meditation and affirmation exercises.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 12
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson further discusses correlation between religious and pagan stories, focusing primarily on the sacrament of the Eucharist, anointing with oil, and the origin of how men became worshiped as Gods. Robinson discusses the nature of these doctrines in a variety of poly of monotheistic religions. He also stresses origins in pagan myths.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 13
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson continues the discussion of the origin of men, like Christ, being labeled and worshipped as Gods as far back as pagan religions. Robinson catalogues various reasons why men ended up being worshipped as Gods, and cites various theologians and scholars to prove his claims. Compares stories from various mono and polytheistic religions.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 14
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson focuses on the story of Creation, claiming the Biblical story of Creation is not true and using science and specifically facts of astronomy, cosmology, anatomy, and biology to discuss how both the universe and people were formed by a natural law that governs all things. Robinson uses the terms God-Power and God-Law interchangeably.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 9
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson further discusses correlation between religious and pagan stories, focusing primarily on the doctrine and 'character' the Holy Ghost. Robinson lists several places where the Holy Ghost is mentioned in the Bible, and then discusses the different permutations, manifestations, and entities of the Holy Ghost in different mono and polytheistic religions.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 15
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson continues discussion of creation, focusing on the connection between the spiritual and material worlds. Robinson discusses the Life Spirit, which animates the body, and also stresses that death is the act of the Life Spirit leaving the body because it sees the body failing to take control. Robinson also discusses the brutality of martyrdom and other violent acts in the name of religion.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 16
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson begins with a poem, and discusses the law that governs nature. Robinson provides several examples of the way things occur in nature as evidence of the God-Law, or force that governs nature, that comes from the Spiritual Realm to govern all things. Robinson makes prophecies of the future, claiming that evolution of man is not complete.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 17
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson begins discussing the fate of orthodox religion. Robinson discusses the vast differences socially and economically in America from 1917 to 1936, and the disillusionment and lack of faith people have in doctrines both secular and religious. He claims they no longer trust the institutions that were once and remain in place. He also uses a variety of quotes from writers, generals, leaders, etc. Missing end page(s).
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 18
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson begins with the continuation of an address made by George H. Cless, Jr., though the previous lesson doesn't seem to end with Cless's address. Lesson claims the Church is facing its biggest challenge in recent years. Aside from hard-to-believe doctrine, he discusses people's recent disillusionment with religion, using several quotes to support himself.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.; George H. Cless, Jr.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 19
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson begins by critically entertaining Biblical ideas of the Creation, only to decide reason dictates that evolution of the universe took millions of years. Robinson discusses scientific developments in the recent 50 years and uses this as well as articles and quotes to discuss the role of the Life Spirit and God Realm.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 20
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson prompted by an explosion that killed '450 - 500' school children in Texas (though this lesson is dated 1936, Robinson refers to the New London School Explosion on March 18, 1937 in New London, Texas in which 295 of the original 425 reported died). Robinson uses this incident to draw lines between what religions call 'the will of god' and laws of nature.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 21-40
record.description: In lessons 21-40, Robinson refers to the first 20 lessons of the Advanced Teaching Course No. Three as individual, basic lessons while the final 20 are meant to be read as 'a path which you have not traveled before.' Lessons begin with discussion of psychology, the subconscious mind, and applying the mind to ideas, then continues with criticism of orthodox religious doctrine, and the general doctrine of Psychiana, the Spirit of God or God-Law, God-Power, and Life Principle or Life Spirit.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: The League of Eternal Life - Lesson Number Seven
record.description: The League of Eternal Life' included a series of shorter lessons intended to be sent out weekly to Psychiana students. Lesson 7 focuses on eternal life on earth and the concept of miracles. Robinson maintains that miracles do not exist because they violate natural law, which comes from God. He then discusses medical advances.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: The League of Eternal Life - Lesson Number Eighteen
record.description: The League of Eternal Life' included a series of shorter lessons intended to be sent out weekly to Psychiana students. Lesson 18 focuses on where we can find God: inside us. Robinson discusses the importance of quiet, and how to find the God-Power through silence, meditation, and quiet talks with God.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Man Can Now Talk with God Study Lesson No. 2
record.description: Printed Lesson with formal, typeset header and illustrations of both Robinson and Tenney. Lesson begins with an account of the organ donation and transplant of an eyeball from one person to another. Robinson uses this to discuss the law that governs nature and forces which allow organs to work. He also cites numerous other examples like electricity. He ultimately discusses the God-Law as an unseen force of nature. Lesson became edited into Advanced Course Number One.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 10
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson further discusses correlation between religious and pagan stories, focusing primarily on 'the Word,' or Word of God, and the Trinity. Robinson discusses different concepts, characteristics, and origins of 'the Word' in various poly and monotheistic religions. Robinson also discusses the Trinity and its potential origins in previous religions.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Man Can Now Talk with God Study Lesson No. 8
record.description: Printed Lesson with formal, typeset header and illustrations of both Robinson and Tenney. Lesson begins listing properties of the God-Law. Robinson discusses different interpretations of quotes from other religions about God living in man, and also discusses the notion of the fear of God and God as a force or law not to be feared. Lesson became edited into Advanced Course Number One.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana
record.rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Man Can Now Talk with God Study Lesson No. 11
record.description: Printed Lesson with formal, typeset header and illustrations of both Robinson and Tenney. Lesson begins discussing the affirmations Robinson asks students to repeat to themselves. Lesson also discusses where success comes from, the location of God in man, and goes in to more depth about what actually happens physically and spiritually when someone says the affirmations. Lesson became edited into Advanced Course Number One.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.

record.title: Man Can Now Talk with God Study Lesson No. 30
record.description: Printed Lesson with formal, typeset header and illustrations of both Robinson and Tenney. Lesson begins quoting a news story of a woman who mutilated herself because she sinned. Robinson uses this to criticize religion and sin, then discusses stories of the crucifixion from many religions that overlap, which disproves authenticity in one religion or another. Lesson became edited into Advanced Course Number One.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 1 - Spanish Translation
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson designed for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson includes the original English lesson, the typescript in Spanish, and the final reprinted edition fully translated into Spanish. Lesson itself deals with the God-Law, which Robinson claims governs all success and failure. He identifies those that have material success and those that have experienced poverty and illness. He discusses how the God-Law brings success.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Advanced Teaching Course Number Three - Lesson No. 11
record.description: Advanced teaching lesson for students to become teachers of Psychiana and spread it to others. Lesson further discusses correlation between religious and pagan stories, focusing primarily on baptism, absolution, and the confession of sins. Robinson discusses doctrine that relates to confessing sins in several monotheistic religions. He also discusses types of baptism--water, fire, blood, and holy ghost--across different religions.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Various Hymns
record.description: Compiled lyrics of the hymns 'Silent Night' and 'Hark the Herald Angels Sing,' along with the other lesser known hymns 'O Jesus I Have Promised,' 'Do Not Pass Me By,' 'Haven of Rest,' 'Jesus Savior Pilot Me,' 'Let the Lower Lights be Burning,' 'Sometime We'll Understand,' and 'Blest be the Tie That Binds.'
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) Lesson No. 5 Sin--What It Is--And What It Is Not
record.description: Lesson discusses Jesus Christ, who Robinson claims taught things so revolutionary and difficult for people to comprehend that they crucified him and proceeded to misinterpret and miscommunicate his actual teachings. Robinson claims the entire system of orthodox Christianity was founded on misunderstandings. He then discusses, at length, the concept of sin in Catholic doctrine.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Hymns for the use in Frank Robinson Campaign
record.description: Compiled lyrics begin with a title page that includes a summary of the Psychiana faith entitled, 'What 'Psychiana' Is.' Includes terms and central doctrine of the religion. Title page and subsequent page also offer students Psychiana lessons for $20.00. Compilation includes lyrics to the hymns 'I Love to Tell the Story,' 'Tell Me the Old, Old Story,' 'Faith of Our Fathers,' 'Blest be the Tie,' 'Let the Lower Lights be Burning,' and 'What a Friend.'

record.title: The Church of Psychiana Hymn Book
record.description: Hymn book includes a cover with a portrait of Robinson, the title, and the caption 'Dr. Frank B. Robinson, Founder of 'Psychiana,' An American Religion for Americans.' Contains 76 hymns, both words and music.

record.title: Testimonials from Psychiana Students
record.description: Typescript is a compilation of testimonials and success stories from Psychiana students. The first pages compile testimonials only a sentence or brief phrase long numbered 1 - 30, often relating to finding the God-Law or God-Power, while latter pages include paragraph long anecdotes and praise. All testimonials include a name, some include street addresses. These excerpts were used in various Psychiana publications such as the Weekly, Monthly, and Bulletin, as well as in follow-up material.
record.creator: Psychiana, Inc.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: A Tribute to Frank B. Robinson, Founder of Psychiana
record.description: Funeral program begins with title and portrait of Robinson. Subsequent pages recount details of Robinson's life, focusing on Psychiana leadership. Bach includes anecdotes about Robinson lecturing in classrooms, his prolific writing, and many of his successes and teachings. He calls Robinson a 'prophet' and discusses the ridicule he faced during his time on earth.
record.creator: Bach, Marcus
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana Quarterly, December 1935
record.description: Issue begins with advertisements for Psychiana with question, 'WHAT IS GOD, REALLY?' and contains various articles on the crucifixion of Jesus, Christmas, Billy Sunday, World War II and violence in Europe, and the state of Religion in Mexico. Issue also includes an inspirational poem and letter from Psychiana student with a story about her eyesight being restored.
record.creator: Psychiana, Inc.

record.title: Psychiana Quarterly, December 1933
record.description: Issue begins with advertisements for Psychiana, with phrase 'PSYCHIANA BROTHERHOOD,' and for Robinson's book 'AMERICAN AWAKENING, the story of The Great Religious Fraud.' Issue includes various articles on the N.R.A., the state of religion in Moscow, a lesson from a series of lessons on brotherhood, and others. Issue also includes an inspirational poem.

record.title: Psychiana Quarterly, March 1936
record.description: Issue begins with advertisements for Psychiana asking, 'WHAT IS GOD, REALLY?' and contains various articles on Robinson's indictment and deportation from the United States, a story in response to a girl who supposedly slept for five days after a religious ceremony, and the afterlife. Issue also includes a letter from Psychiana student supposedly healed of cancer and other letters.

record.description: Issue begins with advertisements for Psychiana asking, 'WHAT IS GOD, REALLY?' and includes several articles on the turmoil and uncertain state of things in the modern world, the persecution of Psychiana, the investigation of Psychiana at the hands of government officials, and the crucifixion.

record.title: Why I Founded Psychiana
record.description: Lesson begins with Robinson telling of his past and childhood home, specifically his upbringing in a Christian home and study of Christian texts. He then discusses his disillusionment with religion and the revelation of Psychiana that followed. He also discusses 'New Psychology,' its relationship with Christ's teachings, and the ability to get what you want in this life rather than waiting for the afterlife.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Why I Founded Psychiana (The Teaching Which is Bringing New Life to a Spiritually Dead World) - Success or Failure; Wealth or Poverty: Which?
record.description: Introductory lesson to Psychiana promises students that the Power Robinson has realized can give them anything 'spiritual or MATERIAL' that they desire. He heavily criticizes the teachings of orthodox religions and explains that if the Power he has realized can govern the entire universe it can give them any material thing they seek.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Psychiana (The New Psychological Religion) - Introductory Lecture
record.description: Lesson focuses on an Immutable Law that governs the universe, the God-Law. Robinson includes several examples of how animals act, behave, and reproduce according to natural law as evidence that this force exists. He also discusses modern psychology, particularly the conscious and subconscious, and its relation to the God-Law and getting people health, wealth, and happiness.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: The Psychiana Religion Information Bulletin 1948
record.description: Bulletin focuses on providing a holistic view of Psychiana, including a history of the religion and it's growth through advertising, the location of Psychiana headquarters, people in its administration, its day to day operations including mail, and a summary of the core teachings. Bulletin also includes photos of Frank B. and Alfred B. Robinson.

record.title: What is Psychiana?
record.description: Bulletin begins by asserting its necessity in light of recent publicity concerning Psychiana. Bulletin focuses on introducing Psychiana's administrative staff, summarizing its teaching and religious philosophy, explaining how Psychiana operates, and detailing Robinson's investment in advertising. Bulletin includes photos of Frank B. Robinson and C.W. Tenney.

record.title: What Is Psychiana - A Concise Yet Comprehensive Brochure Explaining In Detail the Whole Psychiana Movement
record.description: 31 page booklet begins with epigraph from Corinthians and contains pictures and portraits of Psychiana headquarters, Psychiana Staff with names and position titles, Robinson Park, Frank B. Robinson's home and family, and pictures of individual staff members. Also included are copies of letters received from students and some Stephen Bern Dahlman illustrations.

record.title: Psychiana Spiritual Awakening
record.description: Single page flyer/mailer asks the reader to complete three tasks, then sign and remit a form verifying they have done so. The first step is a form of Psychiana prayer, the second step asks the reader to pray for the downfall of Hitler, and the third asks the reader to recognize that God is 'IN ME.'

record.title: American Spiritual Awakening's Sure-Fire Formula for Finding the Power of the Spirit of God. It Cannot Fail.
record.description: Single page flyer that gives nine directions to the reader. Each direction suggests that the 'Power of the Spirit of God' will manifest once spoken into existence. Directions emphasize that the desires must be spoken 'ALOUD AND EARNESTLY' for weeks. The final instruction impels the reader to 'TELL OTHERS. TELL OTHERS. TELL OTHERS.'

record.title: Message to Those Considering Becoming A Teacher and Practitioner of 'Psychiana'
record.description: Photograph under heading of the Institute of Religious Science in Los Angeles. record.title: The 'Psychiana' Revival
record.description: Multi-page mailer includes testimony from church leaders about the apparent status of church attendance and Sunday school attendance, argumentation that the world is on course for destruction and that only Psychiana can save it, history of Dr. Robinson's 'Message,' and a page asking for donations. record.title: The 'American Spiritual Awakening'
record.description: Under the heading 'The 'American Spiritual Awakening'' there is a photograph of Frank B. Robinson and Ernest Holmes sitting in chairs on a stage. The first page invites the reader to repeat daily the prayer 'LET THERE BE IMMEDIATE PEACE ON EARTH THROUGH THE POWER OF THE SPIRIT OF THE LIVING GOD.' The rest of the packet impels the reader to form groups and give donations to Psychiana as he or she is able. Includes donation and group roster/formation form.

record.title: This Life of Fulfillment May be Yours Through the Power Teach
record.description: Illustration and two letters. Illustration of a man wearing academic regalia and bearing a scroll labeled 'TRUTH.' He is walking out of a building labeled 'KNOWLEDGE OF THE LIVING GOD' and down a path labeled 'LIFE OF FULFILLMENT' toward a rising sun. The letter under the illustration discusses the way God is available for all persons. The reverse side contains a letter titled 'A WORD OF WARNING' that states that, although there are wondrous benefits to tapping the God-Power, the knowledge also comes with the responsibility to recruit others to the Psychiana cause.

record.title: Psychiana Monthly, December 1931
record.description: Issue begins with advertisements for Psychiana with phrase 'PSYCHIANA BROTHERHOOD' and photo of young Robinson, with his credentials penned behind his name in blue ink. record.title: Clippings from Psychiana Weekly, April 13, 1940 [02]
record.description: Clippings include a question and answer column with a Psychiana students who asks about the church practices of his family, confesses alcoholism, asks why Robinson quotes from the Bible if he doesn't believe it, and asks if Robinson will ever accept Jesus as his savior. Also includes latter half of an article accusing the Church of repurposed pagan doctrine and discussing the beliefs of Abraham Lincoln.

record.title: Back Again
record.description: Article covering the return of Psychiana monthly to print after several years hiatus. Robinson reports the growth of Psychiana and Psychiana facilities in that time, and begins to criticize the method and doctrines of other orthodox religions that believe crucified gods can save anyone. Presumably to be included in Psychiana Monthly, July 1947.
record.creator: Robinson, Frank B.
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student encloses a payment of $11.25 and explains that she must hide her study of Psychiana and payments from her husband. She asks several questions of Robinson's interpretation of the Bible, particularly how the Power of God is the same as the Holy Spirit that allowed the apostles speak in tongues.

record.title: Correspondence with Gertrude Ace
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student expresses her gratitude for the Psychiana Lessons and explains that she is sharing the lessons with her family. She also includes a list of names, addresses, and details of individuals that she requests Robinson to send an invitation and Psychiana information to.
record.creator: Gertrude Ace; Alfred B. Robinson

record.title: Correspondence with Merle H. Moore
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student discusses a chronic injury sustained during World War I and claims that the Psychiana lessons and affirmations have healed this injury. He also says he looks to Psychiana for financial gain and has included a list of friends (not found) for Psychiana to contact.
record.creator: Moore, Merle H; Frank B. Robinson
record.subjects: World War; Spreading Psychiana; Healing; Success

record.title: Correspondence with Mrs. M. G.
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student states, in broken English and poor spelling, that she has been taken advantage of most her life and asks for strength from Psychiana and its teachings. Tenney responds with a brief letter thank the student for her brave letter and wishing her a Merry Christmas.
record.creator: M. G., Mrs. ; C. W. Tenney
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Correspondence with E. G. Bairy
record.description: Correspondence in which Tenney notified a student they may be violating federal law by copying lessons. The student responds accepting responsibility, but claims the lessons were copied out of good faith and distributed to friend who are too poor to afford lessons. Robinsons addresses this and informs this student that he personally charge him criminally for ANY copying and redistribution of Psychiana materials.
record.creator: Bairy, E. G.; Frank B. Robinson
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Correspondence with Mr. Hugh Fraser
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student reports he is in the oil business and stresses there is no limit to the Power of God. He states he could use help financially with his oil business, specifically by winning the Canadian Sweepstakes at the end of the month. Tenney responds with a form letter.
record.creator: Fraser, Hugh; C. W. Tenney
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Correspondence with Sarah Kershaw
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student explains her current situation of poverty and destitution, addresses her inability to pay her balance due on her Psychiana account, and promises to spend her life "linking up" with Psychiana. She also includes some hymns she wrote for a campaign and a picture of Roosevelt. Tenney responds with a brief letter.
record.creator: Kershaw, Sarah; C. W. Tenney

record.title: Correspondence with Grace Mitchell
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana reports on her recent financial stability, a raise at work for $5 in wages, after starting Psychiana. She also reports she now studies with her husband, includes a payment of $2.25, and an enrollment form to become an "ordained minister" of Psychiana. Payment amount is noted at the beginning of the letter in pencil.

record.title: Correspondence with C. W. Rehkopf
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student explains a recent injury, a fractured skull, and his quick and unexpected recovery. He attributes this to his faith in Psychiana and says he would like to meet Robinson when he comes to Portland for a convention.
record.creator: Rehkopf, C. W.; C. W. Tenney

record.title: Correspondence with Mr. F. E. Whitmore
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student reports his fear of getting laid off at work, but then not getting laid off and actually becoming the "owner of the job". He notes she didn't have to "bump" anyone to get it and states that Robinson's writing provides him with courage and hope. Robinson responds with a brief letter.

record.title: Correspondence with F. D. Addison
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter to a Psychiana student including an invoice for the amount of money the student has paid and the amount of money the student owes to Psychiana for literature and student materials. record.title: Correspondence with Mr. Jas. R. Morris

Robinson and alluding to an investigation of Psychiana by the federal government. Student mentions Robinson's deportation. record.title: Correspondence with Addie E. Perkins

record.title: Correspondence with Effie D. Avery

record.title: Correspondence with Alfred A. Fuller
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student in which student states he does all the Psychiana lessons and students but consults Robinson because he can't find what's wrong with the clothes hanger he has invented. record.title: Correspondence with W. M. W. McKenzie
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student corrects Robinson's misusage of the events of the life of Saint Paul in Psychiana literature. record.title: Correspondence with W. C. McMahan
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student praises the lessons and articles he has received in Psychiana Weekly and goes on to explain that he has returned to his habit of drinking and asks Robinson to help "throw the Power of God" at the "demon" of whiskey.

record.title: Correspondence with Ella Murelli
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student encloses a 2.00 donation and apologizes for her inability to pay Psychiana for the lessons. She explains that she feels her luck is turning and that she will soon be able to pay her debt. She also explains how Psychiana makes her feel, including a "tingling" feeling.

record.title: Correspondence with Mary E. Alexander
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student expresses her concern for preacher that has missed the point of the Power of the Living God, but she believes in this preacher. She includes a letter from this preacher, who prophesizes doom and destruction in the atomic age and in a world of hedonism and godlessness.

record.title: Correspondence with Chief Moses White Horse, Sr.
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student and Assiniboine Indian, who explains much of his life experience, including personal details of the death of his parents and youth, his life on a reservation in Montana, and his discovery and acceptance of Psychiana and the "Creative Intelligence."

record.title: Correspondence with Rev. Chas. Sidney Burke
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Baptist Reverend who states he has read the teachings of Psychiana and they have reaffirmed his beliefs. record.title: Correspondence with Lottie Michaels
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student writes to Robinson with a lack of punctuation and conventional grammar. Student reminds Robinson about his father who was diagnosed with cancer and is doing much better. Student also refers to ""The Way"" magazine.

record.title: Correspondence with Ted Miller
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student explains that he has suffered from old age, debt, and poverty but eventually overcame all those hardships after discovering Psychiana. record.title: Correspondence with Ethel M. Peden
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student explains that she mailed in a check for a subscription to ""The Way"" magazine and a book by Robinson, but claims she never received the book. She also states her student ID, revealing a number system by which student records were kept, tracked, and used as identification.
record.creator: Peden, Ethel M.; Alfred B. Robinson
record.subjects: Student Numbers; The Way; Robinson's Books
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Correspondence with Curtis Smith
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student expresses his interest in buying more lessons but can't due to poverty in Europe, his home, and the ""political chess game"" happening there. He includes the names and contact information of two friends and a photo of himself playing the trumpet.
record.creator: Curtis Smith; Alfred B. Robinson

record.title: Correspondence with Elsie Nininger
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student asks Robinson for help with her troubles, particularly dental issues that her son and daughter are both suffering, which costs her much money. She also encloses a dollar and asks for a subscription to Psychiana Weekly and more material to read to be closer to God.
record.creator: Nininger, Elsie; C. W. Tenney

record.title: Correspondence with Jim Spring
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student states he is getting over Anthropophobia, or a fear of people. He also speaks articulately about doing well in high school despite having been a poor student for years. He writes very articulately and maturely.
record.creator: Spring, Jim; Alfred B. Robinson
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Correspondence with Hattie L. Smith
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student explains how well she likes Psychiana and transitions into asking Robinson for help because is struggling with diabetes and would like advice and help and healing.
record.creator: Hattie L. Smith; Alfred B. Robinson

record.title: Correspondence with Ester Vanselow
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student expresses her concerns for an upcoming trip to Europe for the purpose of adopting children. She vents to Robinson and asks for his advice and help. She also mentions writing to him about these anxieties multiple times.
record.creator: Vanselow, Ester; Alfred B. Robinson

record.title: Correspondence with W. I. Chancey
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student encloses payment for lessons and requests the advanced lessons. He states how much these work and claims that a Methodist minister he knows preachers about the God-Power. Some statements are underlined in red by the recipient, perhaps for use as testimonials.
record.creator: Chancey, W. I.; Alfred B. Robinson
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Correspondence with R. R. Chappell
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student responds to the death of Frank B. Robinson with a lengthy, heartfelt letter about his life and suffering before coming to Psychiana and experiencing its Power and healing. In a return letter, Alfred B. Robinson explains the cause of his father's death.
record.creator: Chappell, R. R.; Alfred B. Robinson

record.title: Correspondence with Kay Keithly
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student asks why, after having completed the lessons, she hasn't received the ""flash"" or feeling of God. Student catalogues different physical sensations, including tingling and seeing spots. Alfred B. Robinson writes back informing student that Frank B. Robinson has died.
record.creator: Keithly, Kay; Alfred B. Robinson

record.title: Correspondence with Mrs. Keneklis
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student writes to send her condolences in regards to the death of Frank B. Robinson and praises what he did to improve her life. She explains that she can't write well and that is why she doesn't write much. She encloses $1.00.
record.creator: Keneklis, Mrs.; Alfred B. Robinson

record.title: Correspondence with Reba L. Kesler
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student explains how she doubted Psychiana initially, but came to embrace it and what it did for her as a person and as a business woman who has been successful. Alfred B. Robinson responds informing her that his father has died.
record.creator: Kesler, Reba L.; Alfred B. Robinson

record.title: Correspondence with Natham Kimble
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student mentions reading the children's lessons. He claims to be doing better, but also mentions problems with money and his health. He also mentions a woman named Beulah, who isn't helping his situation. The letter does not follow conventional grammar and contains many misspellings.
record.creator: Kimble, Natham; Alfred B. Robinson
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Correspondence with Chevles Tolojkowski
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student who is also a convict. The student thanks Robinson for donating lessons which he could not afford, and states that these lessons have rehabilitated him in a way that the penitentiary never could. He also states he is now a socialist, assumedly because of his student of Psychiana.
record.creator: Chevles Tolojkowski; Alfred B. Robinson
record.source: MG 101, Frank Bruce Robinson. Papers, 1929-1951, University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives, http://archiveswest.orbiscascade.org/ark:/80444/xv97133/op=fstyle.aspx?t=k&q=psychiana

record.title: Correspondence with Jeanette Smith
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student explains her unfaltering loyalty and dedication to Psychiana. She goes on to discuss ""Psychiana groups"" that wants to form so that Psychiana can grow and grow.
record.creator: Smith, Jeanette; Alfred B. Robinson
record.subjects: Spreading Psychiana; Living God; Study Groups

record.title: Correspondence with Mildred Spafford
record.description: Correspondence includes a letter in which Psychiana student addresses many issues, including healing and the science of modern medicine, theories of creation chiropractors, and her personal faith in certain healing sciences. Alfred B. Robinson responds with a form letter and letter instructor to seek a physician if she has an affliction.
record.creator: Spafford, Mildred; Alfred B. Robinson
